4	O
Rawlins	O
Copper-Gold	O
Project	O
Approximately	O
20km	O
west	O
of	O
the	O
Mt	O
Weary	O
,	O

5	O

3	O
kilometres	O
comprising	O
the	O
Rough	O
Gully	O
Prospect	O

Copper	O
Knob	O
Prospect	O
,	O
and	O
Eastern	O
Star	O
Prospect.	O
These	O
three	O

are	O
clustered	O
together	O
on	O
the	O
margin	O
of	O
a	O
significant	O
annular	O
feature	O
in	O
regional	O
magnetic	O
datasets.	O

with	O
several	O
zones	O
of	O
surface	O

anomalism	O

surface	O

and	O
mapping	O

the	O
Company	O
in	O

18-month	O
period	O
prior	O
to	O
listing.	O

Rough	O

magnetics	O
feature	O
is	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
buried	O
intrusion	O
not	O
previously	O
recognised.	O

anomalism	O

analyses	O
in	O
April.	O

(	O
6	O
)	O
lines	O
of	O

on	O
50m	O

area	O

of	O

prospect	O
outlined	O
above.	O
Monal	O
Project	O

is	O

of	O

for	O
high-grade	O

project	O
area	O

+5km	O

gold	O

Compliance	O
statement	O
1	O
This	O
statement	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
accounting	O
standards	O
and	O
policies	O
which	O
comply	O
with	O
Listing	O
Rule	O
19.11A.	O
2	O
This	O
statement	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
of	O
the	O
matters	O
disclosed.	O
Date	O
:	O
28	O
April	O
2022	O
Authorised	O
by	O
:	O
Aaron	O
Bertolatti	O
–	O

Company	O
Secretary	O
(	O
Name	O
of	O
body	O
or	O
officer	O
authorising	O
release	O
–	O

see	O
note	O
4	O
)	O
Notes	O
1.	O
This	O
quarterly	O
cash	O
flow	O
report	O
and	O
the	O
accompanying	O
activity	O
report	O
provide	O
a	O
basis	O
for	O
informing	O
the	O
market	O
about	O
the	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
for	O
the	O
past	O
quarter	O
,	O
how	O
they	O
have	O
been	O
financed	O
and	O
the	O
effect	O
this	O
has	O
had	O
on	O
its	O
cash	O
position.	O
An	O
entity	O
that	O
wishes	O
to	O
disclose	O
additional	O
information	O
over	O
and	O
above	O
the	O
minimum	O
required	O
under	O
the	O
Listing	O
Rules	O
is	O
encouraged	O
to	O
do	O
so.	O
2.	O
If	O
this	O
quarterly	O
cash	O
flow	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
,	O
the	O
definitions	O
in	O
,	O
and	O
provisions	O
of	O
,	O
AASB	O
6	O
:	O
Exploration	O
for	O
and	O
Evaluation	O
of	O
Mineral	O
Resources	O
and	O
AASB	O
107	O
:	O
Statement	O
of	O
Cash	O
Flows	O
apply	O
to	O
this	O
report.	O
If	O
this	O
quarterly	O
cash	O
flow	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
other	O
accounting	O
standards	O
agreed	O
by	O
ASX	O
pursuant	O
to	O
Listing	O
Rule	O
19.11A	O
,	O
the	O
corresponding	O
equivalent	O
standards	O
apply	O
to	O
this	O
report.	O
3.	O
Dividends	O
received	O
may	O
be	O
classified	O
either	O
as	O
cash	O
flows	O
from	O
operating	O
activities	O
or	O
cash	O
flows	O
from	O
investing	O
activities	O
,	O
depending	O
on	O
the	O
accounting	O
policy	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O
4.	O
If	O
this	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
authorised	O
for	O
release	O
to	O
the	O
market	O
by	O
your	O
board	O
of	O
directors	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
insert	O
here	O
:	O
“	O
By	O
the	O
board	O
”	O
.	O

If	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
authorised	O
for	O
release	O
to	O
the	O
market	O
by	O
a	O
committee	O
of	O
your	O
board	O
of	O
directors	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
insert	O
here	O
:	O
“	O
By	O
the	O
[name	O
of	O
board	O
committee	O
–	O

eg	O
Audit	O
and	O
Risk	O
Committee]	O
”	O
.	O

If	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
authorised	O
for	O
release	O
to	O
the	O
market	O
by	O
a	O
disclosure	O

,	O
you	O
can	O
insert	O
here	O
:	O
“	O
By	O
the	O
Disclosure	O
Committee	O
”	O
.	O

5.	O
If	O
this	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
authorised	O
for	O
release	O
to	O
the	O
market	O
by	O
your	O
board	O
of	O

Responsibility	O
of	O
the	O
directors	O
for	O
the	O

report	O

directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
are	O

for	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O

that	O

a	O

and	O

view	O

with	O
Australian	O

Standards	O

Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
half-year	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
Our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
express	O
a	O
conclusion	O
on	O
the	O
half-year	O
financial	O
report	O
based	O
on	O
our	O
review.	O
ASRE	O
2410	O
requires	O
us	O
to	O
conclude	O
whether	O
we	O
have	O
become	O
aware	O
of	O
any	O
matter	O
that	O
makes	O
us	O
believe	O
that	O

half-year	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
not	O

with	O

Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O

31	O

and	O

for	O

ended	O
on	O
that	O
date	O
and	O
complying	O
with	O
Accounting	O
Standard	O
AASB	O
134	O
Interim	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Regulations	O
2001.	O
A	O
review	O
of	O
a	O
half-year	O
financial	O
report	O
consists	O
of	O
making	O
enquiries	O
,	O
primarily	O
of	O
persons	O
responsible	O
for	O
financial	O
and	O
accounting	O
matters	O
,	O
and	O
applying	O
analytical	O
and	O
other	O
review	O
procedures.	O
A	O
review	O
is	O
substantially	O
less	O
in	O
scope	O
than	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
and	O
consequently	O
does	O
not	O
enable	O
us	O
to	O
obtain	O
assurance	O
that	O
we	O
would	O
become	O
aware	O
of	O
all	O
significant	O
matters	O
that	O
might	O
be	O
identified	O
in	O
an	O
audit.	O
Accordingly	O
,	O
we	O
do	O
not	O
express	O
an	O
audit	O
opinion.	O

striking	O
magnetic	O
low	O
suggest	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
over	O
a	O
minimum	O
strike	O
of	O
1600m.	O
At	O
the	O
northern	O
end	O
of	O
Oakajee	O
’	O
s	O
tenure	O
,	O
the	O
magnetic	O
low	O
is	O
600m	O
wide	O
tapping	O
to	O
the	O
south	O
in	O
E59/2092	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
approximately	O
200m	O
wide.	O
Only	O
25	O
of	O
the	O
54	O
AC	O
drill	O
holes	O
completed	O
are	O
within	O
this	O
zone.	O
The	O
results	O
are	O
considered	O
encouraging	O
as	O
they	O
show	O
both	O
the	O
felsic	O
rocks	O
and	O
structures	O
that	O
host	O
the	O
high-grade	O
gold	O
veins	O
within	O
the	O
Paynes	O
Find	O
Gold	O
Camp	O
extend	O
south	O
under	O
shallow	O
cover	O
into	O
Oakajee	O
’	O
s	O
tenure.	O
Importantly	O
,	O
these	O
mineralised	O
zones	O
have	O
not	O
previously	O
been	O
effectively	O
targeted	O
by	O
drilling	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
host	O
shallow	O
high-grade	O
gold	O
zones	O
similar	O
to	O
that	O
previously	O
mined	O
in	O
the	O
Paynes	O
Find	O
Camp	O
immediately	O
to	O
the	O
north.	O
Next	O
Exploration	O
Steps	O
The	O
next	O
exploration	O
stage	O
is	O
to	O
re-sample	O
the	O
anomalous	O
gold	O
zones	O
on	O
1m	O
downhole	O
intervals	O
to	O
better	O
define	O
the	O
target	O
zones.	O
This	O
will	O
be	O
followed	O
by	O
infill	O
AC	O
drilling	O
targeting	O
high	O
grade	O
gold	O
zones	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
step	O
out	O
drilling	O
along	O
strike.	O

ASX	O
announcement	O
has	O
been	O

for	O

About	O
the	O
Paynes	O
Find	O
Gold	O
Project	O
-	O

Western	O
Australia	O
The	O
Paynes	O
Find	O
Gold	O
Project	O
is	O
located	O
adjacent	O
to	O
the	O
Paynes	O
Find	O
settlement	O
,	O
approximately	O
455km	O
by	O
road	O
northeast	O
of	O
Perth.	O
The	O
land	O
holding	O
represents	O
the	O
second	O
largest	O
exploration	O
project	O
area	O
within	O
the	O
Paynes	O
Find	O
Greenstone	O
Belt	O
which	O
has	O
produced	O
more	O
than	O
72	O
,	O
000oz	O
of	O
gold.	O
The	O
Paynes	O
Find	O

Project	O
covers	O
mostly	O
greenstone	O
sequences	O
along	O
strike	O
and	O
to	O

west	O

1.	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O

of	O

adopted	O
in	O

,	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O

Cash	O

cash	O

cash	O
on	O

deposits	O
held	O
at	O

with	O

NOTE	O
11.	O
CURRENT	O
ASSETS	O
-	O

TRADE	O
AND	O
OTHER	O
RECEIVABLES	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
-	O

1	O
,	O
800	O
Accrued	O
revenue	O
26	O
,	O
950	O
1	O
,	O
289	O
GST	O
receivable	O
15	O
,	O
791	O
104	O
,	O
432	O
42	O
,	O
741	O
107	O
,	O
521	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method	O
,	O
less	O
any	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment.	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
generally	O
due	O
for	O
settlement	O
within	O
30	O
days.	O
Collectability	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Debts	O
which	O
are	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
uncollectable	O
are	O
written	O
off	O
by	O
reducing	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
directly.	O
A	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
raised	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
objective	O
evidence	O
that	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
collect	O
all	O
amounts	O
due	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
original	O
terms	O
of	O
the	O
receivables.	O
Significant	O
financial	O
difficulties	O
of	O
the	O
debtor	O
,	O
probability	O
that	O
the	O
debtor	O
will	O
enter	O
bankruptcy	O
or	O
financial	O
reorganisation	O
and	O
default	O
or	O
delinquency	O
in	O
payments	O
(	O
more	O
than	O
60	O
days	O
overdue	O
)	O
are	O
considered	O
indicators	O
that	O
the	O
trade	O
receivable	O
may	O
be	O
impaired.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
allowance	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
asset's	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
original	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
relating	O
to	O
short-term	O
receivables	O
are	O
not	O
discounted	O
if	O
the	O
effect	O
of	O
discounting	O
is	O
immaterial.	O
Other	O
receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
less	O
any	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
Goods	O
&	O
Services	O
Tax	O
(	O
‘	O
GST	O
’	O
)	O
and	O
other	O
similar	O
taxes	O
Revenues	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
associated	O
GST	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
tax	O
authority.	O
In	O
this	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
inclusive	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable.	O
The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
authority	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
other	O
receivables	O
or	O
other	O
payables	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
presented	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O
The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
or	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authority	O
,	O
are	O
presented	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O
Commitments	O
and	O
contingencies	O
are	O
disclosed	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
authority.	O
NOTE	O
12.	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
non-current	O

while	O
they	O
are	O

are	O
classified	O
as	O

for	O
sale.	O

are	O

days	O
of	O

$0.12	O
(	O

,	O

Balance	O

2016	O
417	O
,	O

,	O

55	O
,	O
841	O
,	O
095	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
entitle	O
the	O
holder	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
dividends	O
and	O
the	O
proceeds	O
on	O
the	O
winding	O
up	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
in	O
proportion	O
to	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
and	O
amounts	O
paid	O
on	O
the	O
shares	O
held.	O
The	O
fully	O
paid	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
have	O
no	O
par	O
value	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
limited	O
amount	O
of	O
authorised	O
capital.	O
On	O
a	O
show	O
of	O
hands	O
every	O
member	O
present	O
at	O
a	O
meeting	O
in	O
person	O
or	O
by	O
proxy	O
shall	O
have	O
one	O
vote	O
and	O
upon	O
a	O
poll	O
each	O
share	O
shall	O
have	O
one	O
vote.	O
Share	O
buy-back	O
There	O
is	O
no	O
current	O
on-market	O
share	O
buy-back.	O
Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
can	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
stakeholders	O
and	O
to	O
maintain	O
an	O
optimum	O
capital	O
structure	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
capital.	O
Capital	O
is	O
regarded	O
as	O
total	O
equity	O
,	O
as	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
plus	O
net	O
debt.	O
Net	O
debt	O
is	O
calculated	O
as	O
total	O
borrowings	O
less	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O
In	O
order	O
to	O
maintain	O
or	O
adjust	O
the	O
capital	O
structure	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
may	O
issue	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
sell	O
assets	O
to	O
reduce	O
debt.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
would	O
look	O
to	O
raise	O
capital	O
when	O
an	O
opportunity	O
to	O
invest	O
in	O
a	O
business	O
or	O
company	O
was	O
seen	O
as	O
value	O
adding	O
relative	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
parent	O
entity's	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
investment.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
actively	O
pursuing	O
additional	O
investments	O
in	O
the	O
short	O
term	O
to	O
supplement	O
its	O
existing	O
businesses	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
maximise	O
synergies.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
not	O
subject	O
to	O
any	O
financing	O
arrangement	O
covenants.	O
The	O
capital	O
risk	O
management	O
policy	O
remains	O
unchanged	O
from	O
the	O
30	O
June	O
2015	O
Annual	O
Report.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
issued	O
capital	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
equity.	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O

35Notes	O

FINANCIAL	O
INSTRUMENTS	O
Financial	O
risk	O
management	O
objectives	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
activities	O
expose	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
financial	O
risks	O
:	O
market	O
risk	O
(	O
including	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
,	O
price	O
risk	O
and	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
)	O
,	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
liquidity	O
risk.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
overall	O
risk	O
management	O
program	O
focuses	O
on	O
the	O
unpredictability	O
of	O
financial	O
markets	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O
minimise	O
potential	O
adverse	O
effects	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
uses	O
different	O
methods	O
to	O
measure	O
different	O
types	O
of	O
risk	O
to	O
which	O
it	O
is	O
exposed.	O
These	O
methods	O
include	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
interest	O
rate	O
,	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
and	O
other	O
price	O
risks	O
,	O
ageing	O
analysis	O
for	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
beta	O
analysis	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
investment	O
portfolios	O
to	O
determine	O
market	O
risk.	O
Risk	O
management	O
is	O
carried	O
out	O
by	O
senior	O
finance	O
executives	O
(	O
'finance'	O
)	O
under	O
policies	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
(	O
'the	O
Board'	O
)	O
.	O

These	O
policies	O
include	O
identification	O
and	O
analysis	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
exposure	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
appropriate	O
procedures	O
,	O
controls	O
and	O
risk	O
limits.	O
Finance	O
identifies	O
,	O
evaluates	O
and	O
hedges	O
financial	O
risks	O
within	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
operating	O
units.	O
Finance	O
reports	O
to	O
the	O
Board	O
on	O
a	O
monthly	O
basis.	O
Market	O
risk	O
Foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
undertakes	O
certain	O
transactions	O
denominated	O
in	O
foreign	O
currency	O
and	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
through	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
fluctuations.	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arises	O
from	O
future	O
commercial	O
transactions	O
and	O
recognised	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
entity's	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
risk	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
and	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecasting.	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arises	O
from	O
future	O
commitments	O
,	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
Company's	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
Company	O
operates	O
in	O
Australia	O
and	O
Chile	O
and	O
at	O
present	O
has	O
minimal	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
exposure.	O
The	O
Company	O
will	O
potentially	O
have	O
greater	O
exposure	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
as	O
most	O
commodities	O
the	O
Company	O
explores	O
for	O
are	O
traded	O
in	O
US	O
Dollars.	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
the	O
Company's	O
financial	O
position	O
will	O
be	O
adversely	O
affected	O
by	O
movements	O
in	O
interest	O
rates.	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
on	O
short	O
term	O
deposits	O
is	O
not	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
material	O
risk	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
short	O
term	O
nature	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

30	O
June	O
2016	O
Alliance	O

cash	O
instruments	O

.	O

Credit	O
risk	O
Credit	O
risk	O
refers	O
to	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
a	O
counterparty	O
will	O
default	O
on	O
its	O
contractual	O
obligations	O
resulting	O
in	O
financial	O
loss	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
strict	O
code	O
of	O
credit	O
,	O
including	O
obtaining	O
agency	O
credit	O
information	O
,	O
confirming	O
references	O
and	O
setting	O
appropriate	O
credit	O
limits.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
obtains	O
guarantees	O
where	O
appropriate	O
to	O
mitigate	O
credit	O
risk.	O
The	O
maximum	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
to	O
recognised	O
financial	O
assets	O
is	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
any	O
provisions	O
for	O
impairment	O
of	O
those	O
assets	O
,	O
as	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
does	O
not	O
hold	O
any	O
collateral.	O
Liquidity	O
risk	O
Vigilant	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
management	O
requires	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
to	O
maintain	O
sufficient	O
liquid	O
assets	O
(	O
mainly	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
)	O
and	O
available	O
borrowing	O
facilities	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
pay	O
debts	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
they	O
become	O
due	O
and	O
payable.	O

entity	O

risk	O

available	O

Fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
Unless	O
otherwise	O
stated	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
reflect	O
their	O
fair	O
value.	O
The	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
and	O
trade	O
payables	O
are	O
assumed	O
to	O
approximate	O
their	O
fair	O
values	O
due	O
to	O
their	O
short-term	O
nature.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
is	O
estimated	O
by	O
discounting	O
the	O
remaining	O
contractual	O
maturities	O
at	O
the	O
current	O
market	O
interest	O
rate	O
that	O
is	O
available	O
for	O
similar	O
financial	O
instruments.	O
ANNUAL	O
REPORT	O
2016	O
37Notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
NOTE	O
25.	O
FAIR	O
VALUE	O
MEASUREMENT	O
Fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
The	O
following	O
tables	O
detail	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
measured	O
or	O
disclosed	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
three	O
level	O
hierarchy	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
entire	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
,	O
being	O
:	O
Level	O
1	O
:	O
Quoted	O
prices	O
(	O
unadjusted	O
)	O
in	O
active	O
markets	O
for	O
identical	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities	O
that	O
the	O
entity	O
can	O
access	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
Level	O
2	O
:	O
Inputs	O
other	O
than	O
quoted	O
prices	O
included	O
within	O
Level	O
1	O
that	O
are	O
observable	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
either	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
Level	O
3	O
:	O
Unobservable	O
inputs	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
Level	O
1	O
$	O
Level	O
2	O
$	O
Level	O
3	O
$	O
Total	O
$	O
Consolidated	O
-	O

2016	O
Assets	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
188	O
,	O
617	O
-	O

-	O

188	O
,	O
617	O
Total	O
assets	O
188	O
,	O
617	O
-	O

-	O

188	O
,	O
617	O
Consolidated	O
-	O

2015	O
Assets	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
270	O
,	O
680	O
-	O

-	O

270	O
,	O
680	O
Total	O
assets	O
270	O
,	O
680	O
-	O

-	O

270	O
,	O
680	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
held	O
for	O
sale	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
on	O
a	O
non-recurring	O
basis.	O
There	O
were	O
no	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
during	O
the	O
financial	O
year.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principal	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interests.	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O
Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O
38	O

AUSTRALIAN	O
EXPLORATION	O
WILCHERRY	O
PROJECT	O
(	O
100%	O
)	O
The	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O
is	O
located	O
within	O
the	O
southern	O
region	O
of	O
the	O

(	O

1	O

40	O
km	O
north	O
of	O
Kimba	O
in	O
South	O
Australia.	O

seven	O
exploration	O
licences	O
covering	O
1	O
,	O
484	O
km2	O
which	O
are	O
prospective	O
for	O
gold	O
and	O
base	O
metals.	O
Figure1.	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O
location	O
Weednanna	O
gold-iron	O
Deposit	O

most	O

at	O

of	O

5	O

at	O

Weednanna	O

to	O
test	O
for	O
economic	O
concentrations	O
of	O
gold	O
and	O
Iron.	O
Gold	O
at	O
the	O
Weednanna	O
Deposit	O
is	O
located	O
adjacent	O
to	O
,	O
and	O
on	O
the	O
margins	O
of	O
,	O
ironstone	O
and	O
magnetite-rich	O
skarn.	O

late	O

,	O
Alliance	O
reviewed	O
the	O
iron	O
ore	O
potential	O
of	O
Weednanna	O
and	O
commenced	O
selectively	O
analysing	O
Alliance	O
gold	O

sample	O
pulps	O
associated	O
with	O
ironstone	O
and	O

skarn	O
for	O

iron	O

suite	O
of	O

of	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

5All	O
significant	O
iron	O
assay	O
results	O
were	O

to	O
the	O
ASX	O
in	O
an	O

dated	O
31	O

2020	O
in	O
preparation	O
for	O
estimation	O
of	O
an	O
iron	O
mineral	O
resource.	O
Alliance	O
has	O
focussed	O
on	O
producing	O
a	O
Direct	O
Shipping	O
Ore	O
(	O
DSO	O
)	O
without	O
the	O
need	O
for	O
onsite	O

Project	O
Work	O
A	O
small	O
weather	O
station	O
and	O
four	O
dust	O
monitoring	O
stations	O
were	O
installed	O
at	O
Weednanna	O
during	O
the	O
year	O
to	O

baseline	O
environmental	O
data	O
to	O
build	O

pre-mining	O
environmental	O
model	O
for	O
the	O
planned	O
mining	O
area.	O
Data	O
collection	O
and	O
analysis	O
continued	O
throughout	O
the	O
year	O
building	O
our	O
baseline	O
model	O
and	O
shall	O
continue	O
throughout	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
project	O
with	O
data	O
recorded	O
used	O
to	O
manage	O
mine	O
outputs	O
against	O
the	O
stated	O
performance.	O
Alliance	O
has	O
commenced	O
a	O
two-stage	O
research	O
project	O
with	O
the	O
CSIRO	O
to	O
better	O
understand	O
the	O
paragenesis	O
of	O

Weednanna	O
Au-Fe	O
deposit	O
and	O
develop	O

or	O

tools	O
to	O
assist	O
with	O
targeting	O
future	O
exploration.	O

of	O
the	O
project	O
consists	O
of	O
mapping	O
the	O
distribution	O
of	O
alteration	O
mineralogy	O
around	O
the	O
deposit	O
and	O
linking	O
this	O
to	O
geochemistry	O
and	O
age	O
dating	O
granitic	O
rocks.	O

phase	O
of	O
research	O
will	O
be	O

before	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
2021.	O

will	O

core	O

from	O
6	O
diamond	O

to	O

and	O

the	O
gold	O
and	O
iron	O
mineralising	O
events	O
and	O
determine	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
mineralisation.	O
This	O
work	O
will	O
continue	O
through	O
2022.	O

/	O

that	O

of	O
gold	O

within	O
$2	O
,	O
000	O
AUD	O
pit	O
shells	O
(	O
>0.5	O
g/t	O
gold	O
)	O
and	O
>2.0	O
g/t	O
gold	O
underground	O
potential.	O
The	O
gold	O
mineral	O
resource	O
reported	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
contains	O
data	O
from	O
275	O
new	O
drill	O
holes	O
and	O
is	O
calculated	O
with	O
a	O
higher	O
level	O
of	O
geological	O
confidence	O
,	O
represented	O
by	O
a	O
24	O
%	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O
Measured	O
and	O
Indicated	O
resource	O
categories	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
previous	O
year.	O
A	O
16%	O
decrease	O
in	O
total	O
contained	O
ounces	O
from	O
the	O
previous	O
year	O
is	O
largely	O
attributed	O
to	O
an	O
18	O
%	O
decrease	O
in	O
the	O
average	O
density	O
of	O
the	O
deposit.	O
The	O
previous	O
mineral	O
resource	O
,	O
completed	O
in	O
2018	O
,	O
estimated	O
average	O
density	O
values	O
for	O
each	O
gold	O
domain	O
using	O
a	O
database	O
consisting	O
of	O
1	O
,	O
123	O
specific	O
gravity	O
measurements.	O
However	O
,	O
recognising	O
the	O
heterogeneous	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
skarn-altered	O
meta-	O
sediments	O
that	O
host	O
much	O
of	O
the	O
gold	O
at	O
Weednanna	O
,	O
Alliance	O
continued	O
to	O
collect	O
density	O
measurements	O
and	O
increased	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
density	O
database	O
to	O
9	O
,	O
715	O
specific	O
gravity	O
measurements.	O
The	O
outcome	O
of	O
this	O
work	O
resulted	O
in	O
a	O
material	O
decrease	O
in	O
the	O
average	O
density	O
of	O
the	O
deposit	O
from	O
3.58	O
SG	O
to	O
2.95	O
SG.	O
The	O
net	O
outcome	O
is	O
a	O
21	O
,	O
000	O
ounce	O
gain	O
in	O
high	O
geological	O
confidence	O
Measured	O
and	O
Indicated	O
Resources	O
and	O
a	O
49	O
,	O
500	O
ounce	O
reduction	O
in	O
low	O
geological	O
confidence	O
Inferred	O
Resources.	O

to	O
capitalised	O
correctly	O
;	O
net	O
of	O
any	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditures.	O
funding	O
received	O
;	O

accounting	O
of	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
•	O

Reviewing	O
the	O
directors'	O
assessment	O
of	O
expenditures	O
is	O
also	O
considered	O
a	O
key	O
accounting	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
exploration	O
and	O

area	O
as	O

in	O
note	O
2	O
to	O
the	O

expenditures	O
,	O

that	O

59Other	O
information	O
The	O
directors	O
are	O

for	O
the	O

information.	O

information	O

in	O
the	O

’	O
s	O
annual	O
report	O
for	O

year	O
ended	O
30	O

2021	O
,	O
but	O
does	O
not	O

the	O

report	O
and	O
the	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
thereon	O
,	O
which	O
we	O
obtained	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
Chairman	O
’	O
s	O
address	O
,	O
review	O
of	O
operations	O
and	O
tenement	O
schedule	O
reports	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
available	O
to	O
us	O
after	O
that	O
date.	O
Our	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
does	O
not	O
cover	O
the	O
other	O
information	O
and	O
we	O
do	O
not	O
express	O
any	O
form	O
of	O
assurance	O
conclusion	O
thereon.	O
In	O
connection	O
with	O
our	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
read	O
the	O
other	O
information	O
and	O
,	O
in	O
doing	O
so	O
,	O
consider	O
whether	O
the	O
other	O
information	O
is	O
materially	O
inconsistent	O
with	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
or	O
our	O
knowledge	O
obtained	O
in	O
the	O
audit	O
or	O
otherwise	O
appears	O
to	O
be	O
materially	O
misstated.	O
If	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
work	O
we	O
have	O
performed	O
,	O
we	O
conclude	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
this	O
other	O
information	O
,	O
we	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
report	O
that	O
fact.	O
We	O
have	O
nothing	O
to	O
report	O
in	O
this	O
regard.	O
When	O
we	O
read	O
the	O
Chairman	O
’	O
s	O
address	O
,	O
review	O
of	O
operations	O
and	O
tenement	O
schedule	O
reports	O
,	O
if	O
we	O
conclude	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
therein	O
,	O
we	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
communicate	O
the	O
matter	O
to	O
the	O
directors	O
and	O
will	O
request	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
corrected.	O

is	O
not	O
corrected	O

we	O
will	O
seek	O
to	O
have	O
the	O
matter	O

brought	O
to	O
the	O
attention	O
of	O
users	O
for	O
whom	O
our	O

is	O
prepared.	O
Responsibilities	O
of	O
the	O
directors	O
for	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
are	O

for	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O

that	O

a	O
TRUE	O
and	O

view	O
in	O

with	O

Standards	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
TRUE	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
In	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
assessing	O
the	O
ability	O
of	O

Group	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O

,	O

,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
matters	O
related	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
unless	O
the	O
directors	O
either	O

the	O

or	O
to	O
cease	O
operations	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
no	O
realistic	O

but	O
to	O
do	O
so.	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
responsibilities	O
for	O
the	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
Our	O
objectives	O
are	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
issue	O
an	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
that	O
includes	O
our	O
opinion.	O
Reasonable	O
assurance	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
level	O
of	O
assurance	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
guarantee	O
that	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
will	O
always	O
detect	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
when	O
it	O
exists.	O
Misstatements	O
can	O
arise	O
from	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
and	O
are	O
considered	O
material	O
if	O
,	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
they	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
economic	O
decisions	O
of	O
users	O
taken	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
this	O
financial	O
report.	O

The	O
Burns	O
copper	O
gold	O
prospect	O
is	O
situated	O
on	O
the	O
eastern	O
margin	O
of	O
a	O
large	O
interpreted	O
felsic	O
intrusion	O
,	O
termed	O
the	O
Burns	O
Intrusion.	O
The	O
intrusion	O
does	O
not	O
outcrop	O
but	O
features	O
a	O
distinctive	O
annular	O
aeromagnetic	O
and	O
gravity	O
geophysical	O
signature	O
(	O
Figure	O
2	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
has	O
not	O
yet	O
established	O
the	O
association	O
between	O
the	O
larger	O
Burns	O
intrusion	O
and	O
the	O
diorite	O
porphyry	O
intrusions	O
intersected	O
at	O
Burns	O
but	O
consider	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
genetic	O
relationship	O
between	O
them.	O
Broad	O
high-grade	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
is	O
hosted	O
within	O
a	O
newly	O
discovered	O
hematite-pyrite-	O

altered	O
diorite	O

(	O

23	O

2021	O
)	O
that	O
intrudes	O
high	O
Mg	O
basalt	O

the	O

is	O
open	O
to	O
the	O
north	O
and	O
south.	O

1m	O

1	O
,	O
300km2	O
in	O

DANDOKO	O
PROJECT	O
–	O

West	O
Mali	O
(	O
100%	O
interest	O
)	O
The	O
Dandoko	O
permit	O
(	O
134km2	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
within	O
the	O
Kenieba	O
Inlier	O
of	O
western	O
Mali	O
close	O
to	O
several	O
world-class	O
gold	O
deposits	O
,	O
including	O
B2Gold	O
’	O
s	O
5.15Moz	O
Fekola	O
gold	O
project	O
30km	O
to	O
the	O
west	O
and	O
Randgold	O
’	O
s	O
12.5Moz	O
Loulo	O
Gold	O
Mine	O
,	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
north-northwest	O
(	O
Figure	O
2	O
)	O
.	O

Access	O
from	O
the	O
capital	O
city	O
of	O
Bamako	O
is	O
via	O
a	O
high	O
quality	O
sealed	O
road	O
,	O
which	O
passes	O
through	O
the	O
northern	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
project.	O
The	O
tenement	O
is	O
underlain	O
by	O
a	O
Lower	O
Proterozoic	O
Birimian	O
meta-volcanic	O
and	O
meta-sedimentary	O
sequence.	O
A	O
series	O
of	O
dominant	O
NNE-trending	O
faults	O
,	O
displaced	O
by	O
a	O
second	O
set	O
of	O
ESE-trending	O
faults	O
,	O
have	O
been	O
mapped	O
or	O
interpreted	O
from	O
aeromagnetic	O
data.	O
The	O
NNE-trending	O
structures	O
are	O
interpreted	O
as	O
splays	O
emanating	O
from	O
the	O
Senegal	O
Mali	O
Shear	O
Zone	O
(	O
“	O
SMSZ	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
regional	O
scale	O
NNW-	O
trending	O
strike-slip	O
fault	O
,	O
which	O
plays	O
an	O
important	O
role	O
in	O
controlling	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
in	O
the	O
region.	O
The	O
SMSZ	O
hosts	O
no	O
fewer	O
than	O
six	O
major	O
gold	O
deposits	O
for	O
an	O
endowment	O
estimated	O
at	O
greater	O
than	O
40Moz	O
,	O
including	O
Sadiola	O
(	O
13.5Moz	O
)	O
and	O
Loulo	O
(	O
12.5Moz	O
)	O
.	O

Oklo	O
therefore	O
considers	O
the	O
Dandoko	O
Project	O
to	O
be	O
highly	O
prospective	O
for	O
the	O
discovery	O
of	O
significant	O
gold	O
deposits	O
and	O
places	O
particular	O
emphasis	O
on	O
the	O
importance	O
of	O
NNE-trending	O
faults	O
as	O
mineralising	O
conduits.	O

2	O
:	O

and	O

Setting	O

Moussala	O
Projects	O
in	O
west	O
Mali	O
Diabarou	O

a	O

of	O
1.2km	O

1.0km	O

(	O

3	O
)	O
.	O

)	O

untested	O

to	O

immediate	O
east	O
of	O
previous	O
successful	O
reverse	O
circulation	O
(	O
RC	O
)	O
hole	O
(	B-H
RCDK013-19	I-H
)	I-H
drilled	O
in	O
2013	O
that	O
intersected	O
12m	B-D
at	B-E
1.50g/t	B-P
gold	B-M
from	B-E
49m	B-D
and	B-E
20m	B-D
at	B-E
1.44g/t	B-P
gold	B-M
from	B-E
96m.	B-D
During	O
December	O
2015	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
completed	O
6	O
RC	O
holes	O

884m	O
focused	O

of	O

of	O
hole	O
RCDK013-19.	B-H
Hole	O
RCDK015-	B-H
28	O
from	O
this	O
program	O
returned	O
29m	B-D
at	B-E
5.62g/t	B-P
gold	B-M
(	B-E
including	I-E
8m	B-D
at	B-E
12.58g/t	B-P
gold	B-M
)	O
by	O
fire	O
assay	O
from	O
a	O
down	O
hole	O
depth	O
of	O
109	B-D
metres	I-D
,	O
with	O
the	O
hole	O
ending	O
in	O
mineralisation	O
at	O
a	O
vertical	O
depth	O
of	O
approximately	O
105m	B-D
below	O
surface.	O
Due	O
to	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
coarse	O
visible	O
gold	O
,	O
the	O
corresponding	O
interval	O
was	O

by	O
the	O

roll	O

leach	O
method	O
and	O
returned	O
29	O
metres	O
at	O

KIDAL	O
-	O

Mali	O
(	O
Uranium	O
and	O
Base	O
Metals	O
,	O
100%	O
interest	O
)	O
In	O
November	O
2009	O
,	O
Oklo	O
was	O
granted	O
,	O
through	O
a	O
wholly	O
owned	O
Malian	O
subsidiary	O
,	O
two	O
mining	O
concessions	O
over	O
the	O
Kidal	O
Project.	O
Due	O
to	O
ongoing	O
instability	O
in	O
this	O
remote	O
area	O
of	O
Mali	O
,	O
applications	O
for	O
invoking	O
the	O
Force	O
Majeure	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
conventions	O
were	O
lodged	O
with	O
the	O
Malian	O
Government.	O
Accordingly	O
,	O
no	O
work	O
has	O
been	O
carried	O
out	O
on	O
this	O
project	O
over	O
the	O
past	O
three	O
years.	O
This	O
tenement	O
package	O
represents	O
a	O
large	O
landholding	O
with	O
a	O
significant	O
number	O
of	O
targets	O
for	O
uranium	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
other	O
base	O
and	O
precious	O
metals	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
viewed	O
as	O
a	O
strategically	O
important	O
long-term	O
holding	O
of	O

INDEMNIFICATION	O
OF	O
DIRECTORS	O
AND	O
OFFICERS	O
During	O
the	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
paid	O
an	O
insurance	O
premium	O
to	O
insure	O
certain	O
directors	O
and	O
officers	O
including	O
Directors	O
named	O
in	O
this	O
report.	O
The	O
Directors	O
and	O
Officers	O
Liability	O
insurance	O
provides	O
cover	O
against	O
all	O
costs	O
and	O
expenses	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
incurred	O
in	O
defending	O
civil	O
or	O
criminal	O
proceedings	O
that	O
fall	O
within	O
the	O
scope	O
of	O
the	O
indemnity	O
and	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
brought	O
against	O
the	O
officers	O
in	O
their	O
capacity	O
as	O
officers	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
The	O
insurance	O
policy	O
does	O
not	O
contain	O
details	O
of	O
the	O
premium	O
paid	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
individual	O
officers	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
Disclosure	O
of	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
cover	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
premium	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
a	O
confidentiality	O
clause	O
under	O
the	O
insurance	O
policy.	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
not	O
provided	O
any	O
insurance	O
for	O
an	O
auditor	O
of	O
the	O
group.	O

or	O

,	O
including	O
any	O

(	O

of	O
the	O

REMUNERATION	O
REPORT	O
(	O
Audited	O
)	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
nature	O
and	O
amount	O
of	O
remuneration	O
for	O
the	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
and	O
executives	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
role	O
and	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
the	O
position	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
assistance	O
of	O
external	O
surveys	O
and	O
reports	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
experience	O
and	O
qualifications	O
of	O
each	O
individual.	O
The	O
Board	O
ensures	O
that	O
the	O
remuneration	O
of	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
is	O
competitive	O
and	O
reasonable.	O
Fees	O
and	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
Non-	O
executive	O
Directors	O
reflect	O
the	O
demands	O
which	O
are	O
made	O
on	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
responsibilities	O
of	O
the	O
Directors.	O
Non-	O
executive	O
Director	O
’	O
s	O
fees	O
and	O
payments	O
are	O
reviewed	O
annually	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
In	O
undertaking	O
a	O
review	O
of	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
both	O
directors	O
and	O
executives	O
,	O
consideration	O
is	O
given	O
to	O
the	O
respective	O
performance	O
of	O
person	O
during	O
the	O
review	O
period	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
prescribed	O
performance	O
measures	O
or	O
hurdles	O
connected	O
with	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
remuneration.	O
Given	O
the	O
current	O
size	O
,	O
nature	O
and	O
risks	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
incentive	O
options	O
have	O
been	O
used	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
and	O
executives.	O
The	O
grant	O
of	O
such	O
options	O
is	O
at	O
the	O
discretion	O
of	O
the	O
Board	O
and	O
subject	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
,	O
to	O
shareholder	O
approval.	O
The	O
Board	O
believes	O
participation	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Incentive	O
Option	O
Scheme	O
motivates	O
key	O
management	O
and	O
executives	O
with	O
the	O
long	O
term	O
interests	O
of	O
shareholders.	O
The	O
group	O
has	O
not	O
engaged	O
the	O
services	O
of	O
external	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
to	O
advise	O
them	O
on	O
Director	O
and	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
policy.	O
At	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
2015	O
Annual	O
General	O
Meeting	O
,	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
was	O
passed	O
by	O
way	O
of	O
show	O
of	O
hands	O
and	O
no	O
comment	O
was	O
made	O
on	O
this	O
matter	O
by	O
any	O
attendees.	O
Employment	O
Contracts	O
of	O
Directors	O
and	O
Executives	O
Other	O
than	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
Managing	O
Director	O
,	O
noted	O
below	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
do	O
not	O
have	O
formal	O
contracts	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
completion	O
of	O
the	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
financial	O
year.	O
The	O
directors	O
are	O
paid	O
director	O
’	O
s	O
fees	O
under	O

terms	O
agreed	O

(	O

)	O

cash	O

Options	O
granted	O
carry	O
no	O
dividend	O
or	O
voting	O
rights.	O
When	O
exercisable	O
,	O
each	O
option	O
is	O

into	O
one	O
ordinary	O
share.	O

assessed	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
of	O
options	O
granted	O
to	O
the	O
individuals	O
is	O
allocated	O
equally	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
from	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
to	O
vesting	O
date	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
remuneration	O
tables	O
above.	O
Fair	O
values	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
are	O
independently	O
determined	O
using	O
a	O
Binomial	O
Methodology	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
terms	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
dilution	O
,	O

share	O
price	O
at	O

REPORT	O
REMUNERATION	O
REPORT	O
(	O
Audited	O
)	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Securities	O
Trading	O
Policy	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
security	O
trading	O
policy	O
provides	O
guidance	O
on	O
acceptable	O
transactions	O
in	O
dealing	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
various	O
securities	O
,	O
including	O
shares	O
,	O
debt	O
notes	O
and	O
options.	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
security	O
trading	O
policy	O
defines	O
dealing	O
in	O
company	O
securities	O
to	O
include	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Subscribing	O
for	O
,	O
purchasing	O
or	O
selling	O
Company	O
Securities	O
or	O
entering	O
into	O
an	O
agreement	O
to	O
do	O
any	O
of	O
those	O
things	O
;	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
Advising	O
,	O
procuring	O
or	O
encouraging	O
another	O
person	O
(	O
including	O
a	O
family	O
member	O
,	O
friend	O
,	O
associate	O
,	O
colleague	O
,	O
family	O
company	O
or	O
family	O
trust	O
)	O
to	O
trade	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
;	O
and	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Entering	O
into	O
agreements	O
or	O
transactions	O
which	O
operate	O
to	O
limit	O
the	O
economic	O
risk	O
of	O
a	O
person	O
’	O
s	O
holdings	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities.	O
The	O
securities	O
trading	O
policy	O
details	O
acceptable	O
and	O
unacceptable	O
times	O
for	O
trading	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
including	O
detailing	O
potential	O
civil	O
and	O
criminal	O
penalties	O
for	O
misuse	O
of	O
“	O
inside	O
information	O
”	O
.	O

The	O
Directors	O
must	O
not	O
deal	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
without	O
providing	O
written	O
notification	O
to	O
the	O
Chairman.	O
The	O
Chairman	O
must	O
not	O
deal	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
without	O
the	O
prior	O
approval	O
of	O
the	O
Chief	O
Executive	O
Officer.	O
The	O
Directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
disclosure	O
to	O
the	O
market	O
of	O
all	O
transactions	O
or	O
contracts	O
involving	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
shares.	O
This	O
is	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
Audited	O
Remuneration	O

Page	O
40	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O
These	O
policies	O
have	O
been	O
consistently	O
applied	O
to	O
all	O
the	O
years	O
presented	O
,	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consist	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries.	O
Statement	O
of	O
compliance	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
statements	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
,	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Interpretations	O
and	O
complies	O
with	O
other	O
requirements	O
of	O
the	O
law.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
notes	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
comply	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
‘	O
IFRS	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
Directors	O
on	O
30	O
September	O
2016.	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
historical	O
cost.	O
Cost	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
fair	O
values	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
given	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
assets.	O
In	O
the	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
,	O
management	O
is	O
required	O
to	O
make	O
judgments	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
about	O
carrying	O
values	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
readily	O
apparent	O
from	O
other	O
sources.	O
The	O
estimates	O
and	O
associated	O
assumptions	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
historical	O
experience	O
and	O
various	O
other	O
factors	O
that	O
are	O
believed	O
to	O
be	O
reasonable	O
under	O
the	O
circumstance	O
,	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
which	O
form	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
making	O
the	O
judgments.	O
Actual	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
from	O
these	O
estimates.	O
The	O
estimates	O
and	O
underlying	O
assumptions	O
are	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Revisions	O
to	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
estimate	O
is	O
revised	O
if	O
the	O
revision	O
affects	O
only	O
that	O
period	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
of	O
the	O
revision	O
and	O
future	O
periods	O
if	O
the	O
revision	O
affects	O
both	O
current	O
and	O
future	O
periods.	O
Judgments	O
made	O
by	O
management	O
in	O
the	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
that	O
have	O
significant	O
effects	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
estimates	O
with	O
a	O
significant	O
risk	O
of	O
material	O
adjustments	O
in	O
the	O
next	O
period	O
are	O
disclosed	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
relevant	O
notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
group	O
The	O
group	O
has	O
applied	O
the	O
following	O
standards	O
and	O
amendments	O
for	O
the	O
first	O
time	O
for	O
the	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
commencing	O
1	O
July	O
2015	O
:	O
•	O

Interpretation	O
21	O
Accounting	O
for	O
Levies	O
•	O

AASB	O
2013-3	O
Amendments	O
to	O
AASB	O
136	O
–	O

Recoverable	O
Amount	O
Disclosures	O
for	O
Non-	O
Financial	O
Assets	O
•	O

AASB	O
2013-4	O
Amendments	O
to	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
–	O

Novation	O
of	O
Derivatives	O
and	O
Continuation	O
of	O
Hedge	O
Accounting	O
•	O

AASB	O
2015-1	O
Amendments	O
to	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards.	O
The	O
adoption	O
of	O
these	O
standards	O
has	O
not	O
resulted	O
in	O
changes	O
in	O
accounting	O
policies	O
that	O
have	O
resulted	O
in	O
adjustments	O
to	O
the	O
amounts	O

in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
New	O
standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
not	O
yet	O
adopted	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
pronouncements	O
that	O
are	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
but	O
applicable	O
in	O
future	O
accounting	O
periods	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
:	O
Standard	O
Title	O
Summary	O
Effective	O
Date	O
AASB	O
9	O
Financial	O
Replaces	O
the	O
requirements	O
of	O
AASB	O
139	O
for	O
the	O
1/1/2018	O
Instruments	O
classification	O
and	O
measurements	O
of	O
financial	O
assets.	O
This	O
is	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
the	O
first	O
part	O
of	O
Phase	O
1	O
of	O
the	O
IASB	O
’	O
s	O
project	O
to	O
replace	O
IAS	O
39.	O
AASB	O
15	O
Revenue	O
The	O
AASB	O
has	O
issued	O
a	O
new	O
standard	O
for	O
the	O
1/1/2018	O
from	O
recognition	O
of	O
revenue.	O
This	O
will	O
replace	O
AASB	O
118	O
Contracts	O
which	O
covers	O
contracts	O
for	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
and	O
with	O
AASB111	O
which	O
covers	O
construction	O
contracts.	O
Customers	O
The	O
new	O
standard	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
principle	O
that	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
when	O
control	O
of	O
a	O
good	O
or	O
service	O
transfers	O
to	O
a	O
customer	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
notion	O
of	O
control	O
replaces	O
the	O
existing	O
notion	O
of	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards.	O
The	O
standard	O
permits	O
a	O
modified	O
retrospective	O
approach	O
for	O
the	O
adoption.	O
Under	O
this	O
approach	O
entities	O
will	O
recognise	O
any	O
applicable	O
transitional	O
adjustments	O
in	O
retained	O
earnings	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
application	O
(	O
i.e.	O
1	O
July	O
2017	O
)	O
without	O
restating	O
the	O
comparative	O
period.	O
Entities	O
will	O
only	O
need	O
to	O
apply	O
the	O
new	O
rules	O
to	O
contracts	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
completed	O
as	O
of	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
initial	O
application	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
elected	O
not	O
to	O
early	O
adopt	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
pronouncements.	O
These	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
have	O
significant	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
or	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
upon	O
adoption.	O

2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Significant	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
include	O
:	O
-	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
The	O
future	O
recoverability	O
of	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
dependent	O
upon	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
factors	O
including	O
,	O
whether	O
the	O
Company	O
decides	O
to	O
exploit	O
the	O
related	O
lease	O
itself	O
or	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
whether	O
it	O
successfully	O
recovers	O
the	O
related	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset	O
through	O
sale.	O
Factors	O
that	O
could	O
impact	O
future	O
recoverability	O
include	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
reserves	O
and	O
resources	O
,	O
future	O
technological	O
changes	O
which	O
could	O
impact	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
mining	O
,	O
future	O
legal	O
changes	O
(	O
including	O
changes	O
to	O
environmental	O
restoration	O
obligations	O
)	O
and	O
changes	O
to	O
commodity	O
prices.	O
To	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
determined	O
not	O
to	O
be	O
recoverable	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
,	O
profits	O
and	O
net	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
reduced	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
capitalised	O
if	O
activities	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
have	O
not	O
yet	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
that	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O
recoverable	O
reserves.	O
To	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
that	O
this	O
capitalised	O
expenditure	O
should	O
be	O
written	O
off	O
,	O
profits	O
and	O
net	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
reduced	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
The	O
Company	O
measures	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
share-based	O
payment	O
transactions	O
with	O
employees	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
equity	O
instruments	O
at	O
the	O
grant	O
date.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
using	O
a	O
valuation	O
model	O
,	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
in	O
note	O
23.	O
The	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
relating	O
to	O
equity-settled	O
share-based	O
payments	O
would	O
have	O
no	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
but	O
may	O
impact	O
expenses	O
and	O
equity.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
are	O
selected	O
and	O
applied	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
which	O
ensures	O
that	O
the	O
resulting	O
financial	O
information	O
satisfies	O
the	O
concepts	O
of	O
relevance	O
and	O
reliability	O
,	O
thereby	O
ensuring	O
that	O
the	O
substance	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
transactions	O
or	O
other	O
events	O
is	O
reported.	O
The	O
accounting	O
policies	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
have	O
been	O
applied	O
in	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
'company'	O
or	O
'parent	O
entity'	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
'consolidated	O
entity'.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
those	O
entities	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
control.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
control	O
is	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
They	O
are	O
de-consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
Page	O
43	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
between	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
eliminated.	O
Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
The	O
acquisition	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
acquisition	O
method	O
of	O
accounting.	O
A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
,	O
without	O
the	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
,	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
an	O
equity	O
transaction	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
consideration	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
book	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
acquired	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
parent.	O
Non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
results	O
and	O
equity	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
shown	O
separately	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
Losses	O
incurred	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
attributed	O
to	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
even	O
if	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
a	O
deficit	O
balance.	O
Where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
loses	O
control	O
over	O
a	O
subsidiary	O
,	O
it	O
derecognises	O
the	O
assets	O
including	O
goodwill	O
,	O
liabilities	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary	O
together	O
with	O
any	O
cumulative	O
translation	O
differences	O
recognised	O
in	O
equity.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
recognises	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
received	O
and	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
any	O
investment	O
retained	O
together	O
with	O
any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker.	O
The	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
who	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
allocating	O
resources	O
and	O
assessing	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
For	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
cash	O
includes	O
cash	O
on	O
hand	O
and	O
in	O
banks	O
and	O
at	O
call	O
deposits	O
with	O
banks	O
or	O
financial	O
institutions.	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
Debt	O
and	O
equity	O
instruments	O
Debt	O
and	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
either	O
liabilities	O
or	O
as	O
equity	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
substance	O
of	O
the	O
contractual	O
arrangement.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
as	O
a	O
reduction	O
of	O
the	O
proceeds	O
of	O
the	O
equity	O
instruments	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
costs	O
relate.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
are	O
the	O
costs	O
that	O
are	O
incurred	O
directly	O
in	O
connection	O
with	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
those	O
equity	O
instruments	O
and	O
which	O
would	O
not	O
have	O
been	O
incurred	O
had	O
those	O
instruments	O
not	O
been	O
issued.	O
Interest	O
and	O
dividends	O
Interest	O
and	O
dividends	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
expenses	O
or	O
as	O
distributions	O
of	O
profit	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
classification	O
of	O
the	O
related	O
debt	O

instruments	O
or	O

parts	O
of	O
compound	O
instruments.	O

Entities	O

44	O
2016	O

SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
e	O
)	O
Derivative	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
The	O
Group	O
enters	O
into	O
derivative	O
financial	O
instruments	O
to	O
manage	O
its	O
exposure	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
risk	O
,	O
including	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
forward	O
contracts.	O
Further	O
details	O
of	O
derivative	O
financial	O
instruments	O
are	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
18.	O
Derivatives	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
the	O
derivative	O
contract	O
is	O
entered	O
into	O
and	O
are	O
subsequently	O
remeasured	O
to	O
their	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period.	O
The	O
resulting	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
unless	O
the	O
derivative	O
is	O
designated	O
and	O
effective	O
as	O
a	O
hedging	O
instrument	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
event	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
recognition	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
hedge	O
relationship.	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
assets	O
At	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
entity	O
reviews	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
its	O
tangible	O
and	O
intangible	O
assets	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
there	O
is	O
any	O
indication	O
that	O
those	O
assets	O
have	O
suffered	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss.	O
If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
estimated	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
(	O
if	O
any	O
)	O
.	O

Where	O
the	O
asset	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
independent	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
estimates	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
belongs.	O
Recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
In	O
assessing	O
value	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
using	O
a	O
pre-	O
tax	O
discount	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
asset	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
estimates	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
adjusted.	O
If	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
(	O
or	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
estimated	O
to	O
be	O
less	O
than	O
its	O
carrying	O
amount	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
reduced	O
to	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
revaluation	O
decrease.	O
Where	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
subsequently	O
reverses	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
increased	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
had	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
in	O
prior	O
periods.	O
A	O
reversal	O
of	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
revaluation	O
increase.	O
(	O
g	O
)	O
Property	O
,	O

and	O

class	O
of	O

,	O

at	O

less	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
any	O
accumulated	O
depreciation.	O

)	O

Provisions	O
Provisions	O

recognised	O
when	O
the	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
present	O
obligation	O
,	O

future	O
sacrifice	O
of	O
economic	O
benefits	O
is	O
probable	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
provision	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O

is	O
the	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
present	O
obligation	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
uncertainties	O
surrounding	O
the	O
obligation.	O
Where	O
a	O
provision	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
cashflows	O
estimated	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
present	O
obligation	O
,	O
its	O
carrying	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
those	O
cashflows.	O
When	O
some	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
economic	O
benefits	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
a	O
provision	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
recovered	O
from	O
a	O
third	O
party	O
,	O
the	O
receivable	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O

asset	O
if	O

is	O

of	O

(	O
j	O
)	O
Revenue	O
recognition	O

that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O

yield	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset.	O
(	O
k	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
Current	O
tax	O
Current	O
tax	O
is	O
calculated	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
income	O
taxes	O
payable	O
or	O
recoverable	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
tax	O
loss	O
for	O
the	O
period.	O
It	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
and	O
tax	O
laws	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
reporting	O
date.	O
Current	O
tax	O
for	O
current	O
and	O
prior	O
periods	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
liability	O
(	O
or	O
asset	O
)	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
unpaid	O
(	O
or	O
refundable	O
)	O
.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
comprehensive	O
liability	O
method	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
temporary	O
differences	O

between	O

items.	O

)	O
(	O
k	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
In	O
principle	O
,	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
all	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
against	O
which	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
or	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
and	O
tax	O
offsets	O
can	O
be	O
utilised.	O
However	O
,	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
if	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
them	O
arise	O
from	O
the	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
(	O
other	O
than	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
)	O
which	O
affects	O
neither	O
taxable	O
income	O
nor	O
accounting	O
profit.	O
Furthermore	O
,	O
a	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
not	O
recognised	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
goodwill.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
on	O
investments	O
in	O
subsidiaries	O
,	O
branches	O
,	O
associates	O
and	O
joint	O
ventures	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
arising	O
from	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
associated	O
with	O
these	O
investments	O
and	O
interests	O
are	O
only	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
there	O
will	O
be	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
profits	O
against	O
which	O
to	O
utilise	O
the	O
benefits	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
they	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
tax	O
rates	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
to	O
the	O
period	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
when	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
liability	O
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
them	O
are	O
realised	O
or	O
settled	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
tax	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
reporting	O
date.	O
The	O
measurement	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
reflects	O
the	O
tax	O
consequences	O
that	O
would	O
follow	O
from	O
the	O

in	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
expects	O
,	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O

to	O
recover	O
or	O
settle	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
they	O
relate	O
to	O
income	O
taxes	O
levied	O
by	O
the	O
same	O

authority	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
intends	O
to	O
settle	O
its	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis.	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
or	O
income	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
when	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
credited	O
or	O
debited	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
to	O
equity	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
also	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
or	O
where	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
the	O
initial	O
accounting	O
for	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
taken	O
into	O
account	O
in	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
goodwill	O
or	O
excess.	O
(	O
l	O
)	O
Goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
Revenues	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
(	O
GST	O
)	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
Australian	O
Tax	O
Office	O
(	O
ATO	O
)	O
.	O

In	O
these	O
circumstances	O
the	O
GST	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
item	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
with	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
included.	O
The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
ATO	O
is	O
included	O
as	O
a	O
current	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O
The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
and	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
ATO	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O
1.	O

OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O

)	O

(	O

)	O
Employee	O
benefits	O
Short-term	O
employee	O
benefits	O
Liabilities	O
for	O

up	O

reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O

at	O
the	O

to	O

benefits	O

liability	O
for	O

leave	O
and	O

service	O

not	O

of	O

of	O

value	O
of	O

payments	O
to	O

of	O

employees	O
up	O
to	O

of	O

Share-based	O
payments	O
Equity-settled	O
and	O
cash-settled	O
share-based	O
compensation	O
benefits	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees.	O
Equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
shares	O
,	O
or	O
options	O
over	O
shares	O
that	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
the	O
rendering	O
of	O
services.	O
Cash-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
cash	O
for	O
the	O
exchange	O
of	O
services	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
cash	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
share	O
price.	O
The	O
costs	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
on	O
grant	O
date.	O
Fair	O

is	O
independently	O
determined	O
using	O
either	O
the	O
Binomial	O
or	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
dilution	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
expected	O
price	O
volatility	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
share	O
,	O
the	O
expected	O
dividend	O
yield	O
and	O
the	O
risk	O
free	O
interest	O
rate	O
for	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
together	O
with	O
non-	O
vesting	O
conditions	O
that	O
do	O
not	O

whether	O

consolidated	O
entity	O

the	O
services	O
that	O

to	O

payment.	O

account	O
is	O
taken	O
of	O
any	O
other	O

conditions.	O

an	O

over	O

period.	O

to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O

on	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
,	O

best	O

of	O

of	O

are	O

to	O

the	O

the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
increased	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
had	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
in	O
previous	O
years.	O
Where	O
a	O
decision	O
is	O
made	O
to	O
proceed	O
with	O
development	O
,	O
accumulated	O
expenditure	O
is	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
and	O
transferred	O
to	O
capitalised	O
development	O
and	O
then	O
amortised	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
reserve	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
once	O
mining	O
operations	O
have	O
commenced.	O
Development	O
expenditure	O
is	O
recognised	O
at	O
cost	O
less	O
any	O
impairment	O
of	O
losses.	O
Where	O
commercial	O
production	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
has	O
commenced	O
,	O
the	O
associated	O
costs	O
are	O
amortised	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
reserves	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O
Changes	O
in	O
factors	O
such	O
as	O
estimates	O
of	O
proved	O
and	O
probable	O
reserves	O
that	O
affect	O
unit	O
of	O
production	O
calculations	O
are	O
dealt	O
with	O
on	O
a	O
prospective	O
basis.	O
(	O
q	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principle	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interest.	O
For	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
its	O
highest	O
and	O
best	O
use.	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O
Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O
For	O
recurring	O
and	O
non-recurring	O
fair	O
value	O
measurements	O
,	O
external	O
valuers	O
may	O
be	O
used	O
when	O
internal	O
expertise	O
is	O
either	O
not	O
available	O
or	O
when	O
the	O
valuation	O
is	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
significant.	O
External	O
valuers	O
are	O
selected	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
knowledge	O
and	O
reputation.	O
Where	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
significant	O
change	O
in	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
from	O
one	O
period	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
an	O
analysis	O
is	O
undertaken	O
,	O
which	O
includes	O
a	O
verification	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
inputs	O
applied	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
valuation	O
and	O
a	O
comparison	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
with	O
external	O
sources	O
of	O
data.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
Page	O
51	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
r	O
)	O
Contributed	O
equity	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
equity	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
options	O
are	O
shown	O
in	O
equity	O
as	O
a	O
deduction	O
net	O
of	O
tax	O
,	O
from	O
the	O
proceeds.	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
options	O
for	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
are	O
not	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
purchase	O
consideration.	O
If	O
the	O
entity	O
reacquires	O
its	O
own	O
equity	O
instruments	O
,	O
e.g.	O
as	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
share	O
buyback	O
,	O
those	O
instruments	O
are	O
deducted	O
from	O
equity	O
and	O
the	O
associated	O
shares	O
are	O
cancelled.	O
No	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
the	O
consideration	O
paid	O
including	O
any	O
directly	O
attributable	O
incremental	O
costs	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
income	O
taxes	O
)	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
Acquisition	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
goodwill	O
The	O
purchase	O
method	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
all	O
acquisitions	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
including	O
business	O
combinations	O
)	O
regardless	O
of	O
whether	O
equity	O
instruments	O
or	O
other	O
assets	O
are	O
acquired.	O
Cost	O
is	O
measured	O
as	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
assets	O
given	O
,	O
shares	O
issued	O
or	O
liabilities	O
incurred	O
or	O
assumed	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
plus	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition.	O
Where	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
issued	O
in	O
an	O
acquisition	O
,	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
instruments	O
is	O
their	O
published	O
market	O
price	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
unless	O
,	O
in	O
rare	O
circumstances	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
demonstrated	O
that	O
the	O
published	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
is	O
an	O
unreliable	O
measure	O
of	O
fair	O
value.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
Identifiable	O
assets	O
acquired	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
contingent	O
liabilities	O
assumed	O
in	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
are	O
measured	O
initially	O
at	O
their	O
fair	O
values	O
at	O
the	O
acquisition	O
date	O
,	O
irrespective	O
of	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
any	O
minority	O
interest.	O
The	O
excess	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
over	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
identifiable	O
net	O
assets	O
acquired	O
is	O
recorded	O
as	O
goodwill	O
and	O
not	O
amortised	O
,	O
but	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
annually	O
and	O
whenever	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
indication	O
that	O
the	O
goodwill	O
may	O
be	O
impaired.	O
Any	O
impairment	O
is	O
recognised	O
immediately	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
subsequently	O
reversed.	O
If	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
is	O
less	O
than	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
combination	O
,	O
the	O
difference	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
Where	O
settlement	O
of	O
any	O
part	O
of	O
cash	O
consideration	O
is	O
deferred	O
,	O
the	O
amounts	O
payable	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange.	O
The	O
discount	O
rate	O
used	O
is	O
the	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
incremental	O
borrowing	O
rate	O
,	O
being	O
the	O
rate	O
at	O
which	O
a	O
similar	O
borrowing	O
could	O
be	O
obtained	O
from	O
an	O
independent	O
financier	O
under	O
comparable	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions.	O
(	O
t	O
)	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O
Collectability	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Debts	O
which	O
are	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
uncollectible	O
are	O
written	O
off.	O
An	O
allowance	O
for	O
doubtful	O
receivables	O
is	O
established	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
objective	O
evidence	O
that	O
the	O
Entity	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
collect	O
all	O
amounts	O
due	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
original	O
terms	O
of	O
receivables.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
allowance	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O
The	O
movement	O
of	O
the	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O

the	O

Capital	O

The	O

’	O
s	O
objectives	O
when	O

capital	O
are	O
to	O

their	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
can	O
continue	O
its	O

and	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O

is	O
the	O
board	O
’	O
s	O
current	O
policy	O
,	O
which	O
it	O
has	O
operated	O
since	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
inception	O
,	O
that	O
given	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
its	O
business	O
,	O
to	O

its	O
operations	O
without	O
the	O

of	O
external	O

of	O

to	O
assess	O
its	O

capital	O
needs	O
and	O
to	O

capital	O
is	O

to	O
meet	O
those	O
needs.	O

financial	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
a	O
regular	O
basis	O
against	O
this	O
budget	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
meeting	O
its	O
cash	O
inflow	O

outflow	O
targets.	O

SOCAF	O

of	O

18.	O
FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Group	O
attempts	O
to	O
mitigate	O
risks	O
that	O
may	O
affect	O
its	O
future	O
performance	O
through	O
a	O
process	O
of	O
identifying	O
,	O
assessing	O
,	O
reporting	O
and	O
managing	O
risks	O
of	O
corporate	O
significance.	O
The	O
board	O
considers	O
the	O
principal	O
risks	O
of	O
our	O
business	O
,	O
particularly	O
during	O
the	O
strategic	O
planning	O
and	O
budget	O
processes.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O

)	O
Credit	O
risk	O

e	O
)	O
Foreign	O
Exchange	O
Risk	O
A	O
risk	O
arises	O
when	O
future	O
commercial	O
transactions	O
and	O
recognised	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
other	O
than	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
Group	O
operates	O
internationally	O
,	O
with	O
its	O
major	O
assets	O
being	O
held	O
in	O
Mali	O
,	O
West	O
Africa	O
and	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arising	O
from	O
currency	O
exposures	O
to	O
the	O
Euro	O
,	O
FCFA	O
(	O
fixed	O
to	O
the	O
Euro	O
)	O
and	O
US	O
Dollar.	O
Historically	O
,	O
given	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
expenditure	O
and	O
available	O
funding	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
considered	O
its	O
exposure	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
was	O
minimal	O
and	O
hedging	O
policies	O
were	O
not	O
adopted.	O
Following	O
the	O
$10	O
million	O
capital	O
raising	O
completed	O
in	O
June	O
2016	O
,	O
given	O
the	O
particularly	O
volatile	O
and	O
uncertain	O
position	O
of	O
foreign	O
currency	O
markets	O
globally	O
at	O
that	O
time	O
and	O
knowing	O
that	O
a	O
substantial	O
exploration	O
program	O
would	O
be	O
completed	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
12	O
months	O
,	O
the	O
Board	O
and	O
management	O
considered	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
enter	O
into	O
forward	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
contracts	O
to	O
cover	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
possible	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risks	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
for	O
the	O
following	O
12	O
months.	O
The	O
Board	O
considers	O
policies	O
relating	O
to	O

Foreign	O
