Risk	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Foreign	O
Currency	O
Sensitivity	O
Analysis	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
mainly	O
exposed	O
to	O
Euro	O
and	O
US	O
Dollars.	O
The	O
following	O
table	O
details	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
sensitivity	O
to	O
a	O
10%	O
increase	O
and	O
decrease	O
in	O
the	O
Australian	O
dollar	O
against	O
the	O
relevant	O
foreign	O
currencies.	O
10%	O
is	O
the	O
sensitivity	O
rate	O
that	O
represents	O
management	O
’	O
s	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
reasonably	O
possible	O
change	O
in	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rates.	O
The	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
includes	O
only	O
outstanding	O
foreign	O
currency	O
denominated	O
monetary	O
items	O
and	O
adjusts	O
their	O
translation	O
at	O
the	O
year	O
end	O
for	O
a	O
10%	O
change	O
in	O
foreign	O
currency	O
rates.	O
A	O
positive	O
number	O
below	O
indicates	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
profit	O
where	O
the	O
Australian	O
dollar	O
strengthens	O
10%	O
against	O
the	O
relevant	O
currency.	O
For	O
a	O
10%	O
weakening	O
of	O
the	O
Australian	O
dollar	O
against	O
the	O
relevant	O
currency	O
,	O
there	O
would	O
be	O
a	O
comparable	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
profit	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
balances	O
below	O
would	O
be	O
negative.	O

US	O
Dollars	O

)	O
Share	O
option	O
plan	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
an	O
Incentive	O
Option	O
Scheme	O
(	O
“	O
Scheme	O
”	O
)	O
for	O
executives	O
and	O
employees	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
Scheme	O
,	O
as	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
shareholders	O
at	O
the	O
August	O
2016	O
annual	O
general	O
meeting	O
,	O
executives	O
and	O
employees	O
may	O
be	O
granted	O
options	O
at	O
the	O
discretion	O
of	O
the	O
directors.	O
Each	O
share	O
option	O
converts	O
into	O
one	O
ordinary	O
share	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
on	O
exercise.	O
No	O
amounts	O
are	O
paid	O
or	O
are	O
payable	O
by	O
the	O
recipient	O
on	O
receipt	O
of	O
the	O
option.	O
The	O
options	O
carry	O
neither	O
rights	O
of	O
dividends	O
nor	O
voting	O
rights.	O
Options	O
may	O
be	O
exercised	O
at	O
any	O
time	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
vesting	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
their	O
expiry.	O
Options	O
issued	O
to	O
directors	O
are	O
not	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Scheme	O
but	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
approval	O
by	O
shareholders.	O

DECLARATION	O

ENTITIES	O

121	O
582	O
607	O
DIRECTORS	O
’	O
DECLARATION	O
The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
declare	O
that	O
:	O
1.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
,	O
comprising	O
the	O
consolidated	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
consolidated	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
consolidated	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
consolidated	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O

notes	O

are	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
comply	O
with	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Corporations	O
Regulations	O
2001	O
and	O
other	O
mandatory	O
professional	O
reporting	O
requirements	O
;	O
and	O
,	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
give	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
position	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
and	O
of	O
the	O
performance	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
on	O
that	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
2.	O
In	O
the	O
directors	O
’	O
opinion	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
reasonable	O
grounds	O
to	O
believe	O
that	O
the	O
Company	O
will	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
pay	O
its	O
debts	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
they	O
become	O
due	O
and	O
payable.	O
3.	O

directors	O
have	O
been	O

the	O
required	O
declarations	O
by	O
the	O
chief	O
executive	O
officer	O

from	O

during	O

Directors	O
’	O
Responsibility	O
for	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O

that	O

a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
theCorporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O

that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
In	O
Note	O
1	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
also	O
state	O
,	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Accounting	O
Standard	O
AASB	O
101	O
Presentation	O
of	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
,	O
that	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
comply	O
withInternational	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards.	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Responsibility	O
Our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
express	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
based	O
on	O
our	O
audit.	O
We	O
conducted	O
our	O
audit	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards.	O
Those	O
standards	O
require	O
that	O
we	O
comply	O
with	O
relevant	O
ethical	O
requirements	O
relating	O
to	O
audit	O
engagements	O
and	O
plan	O
and	O
perform	O
the	O
audit	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement.	O
An	O
audit	O
involves	O
performing	O
procedures	O
to	O
obtain	O
audit	O
evidence	O
about	O
the	O
amounts	O
and	O
disclosures	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
The	O
procedures	O
selected	O
depend	O
on	O
the	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
judgement	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
In	O
making	O
those	O
risk	O
assessments	O
,	O
the	O
auditor	O
considers	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
design	O
audit	O
procedures	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
expressing	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
effectiveness	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
internal	O
control.	O
An	O
audit	O
also	O
includes	O
evaluating	O
the	O
appropriateness	O
of	O
accounting	O
policies	O
used	O
and	O
the	O
reasonableness	O
of	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
made	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
evaluating	O
the	O
overall	O
presentation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
We	O
believe	O
that	O
the	O
audit	O
evidence	O
we	O
have	O
obtained	O
is	O
sufficient	O
and	O
appropriate	O
to	O
provide	O
a	O
basis	O
for	O
our	O
audit	O
opinion.	O
Independence	O

conducting	O

audit	O
,	O

have	O
complied	O
with	O
the	O
independence	O

of	O

53	O
CHAIRMAN	O
’	O
S	O
LETTER	O
Dear	O
Shareholders	O
The	O
2021	O
financial	O
year	O
has	O
been	O
an	O
exciting	O
year	O
for	O
your	O
company	O
,	O
with	O
successes	O
achieved	O
at	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
(	O
Au/Cu	O
)	O
,	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
(	O
Au	O
)	O
and	O
Lake	O
Johnstone	O
(	O
Ni	O
)	O
.	O

In	O
all	O
,	O
over	O
34	O
,	O
000	O
metres	O
of	O
diamond/RC/aircore	O
was	O
drilled	O
and	O
significant	O
auger	O
and	O
geophysical	O
surveys	O
were	O
completed.	O
It	O
is	O
pleasing	O
to	O
report	O
that	O
the	O
safety	O
,	O
environmental	O
and	O
community	O
performance	O
at	O
our	O
projects	O
has	O
again	O
been	O
excellent	O
and	O
congratulate	O
all	O
staff	O
and	O
contractors	O
for	O
their	O
preparation	O
and	O
diligence	O
,	O
especially	O
while	O
carrying	O
out	O
their	O
fieldwork.	O
As	O
100%	O
operator	O
in	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
(	O
266	O
sq	O
km	O
)	O
,	O
we	O
extended	O
our	O
knowledge	O
of	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
at	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
,	O
Hang	O
Glider	O
Hill	O
and	O
Havelock	O
and	O
from	O
January	O
2001	O
we	O
conducted	O
several	O
large	O
drill	O
and	O
geophysical	O
programs	O
to	O
define	O
Au/Cu	O
mineralisation	O
trends	O
at	O
the	O
newly	O
acquired	O
Burns	O
project.	O
At	O
the	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
project	O
(	O
372	O
sq	O
km	O
)	O
,	O
our	O
partner	O
Goldfields	O
completed	O
14	O
,	O
723m	O
of	O
drilling	O
and	O
in	O
June	O
2021	O
decided	O
to	O
exercise	O
its	O
option	O
to	O
purchase	O
50%	O
of	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
and	O
spend	O
up	O
to	O
another	O
$15m	O
over	O
the	O
next	O
three	O
years	O
seeking	O
major	O
discoveries	O
under/around	O
Lake	O
Lefroy.	O
The	O
commercial	O
arrangements	O
for	O
the	O
extension	O
included	O
return	O
of	O
the	O
high	O
potential	O
Coogee	O
South	O
area	O
to	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
project	O
and	O
$1.38m	O
cash.	O
At	O
Lake	O
Johnson	O
we	O
have	O
confirmed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
nickel	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
started	O
planning	O
for	O
exploration	O
to	O
define	O
mineable	O
nickel	O
resources	O
in	O
the	O
coming	O
year.	O
Undoubtedly	O
the	O
highlight	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
was	O
the	O
high-grade	O
Au/Cu	O
intercept	O
at	O
Burns	O
in	O
March	O
2021.	O
We	O
will	O
do	O
more	O
to	O
properly	O
follow	O
this	O
up	O
in	O
the	O
near	O
future	O
,	O
but	O
are	O
currently	O
constrained	O
by	O
long	O
assay	O
times.	O
What	O
we	O
already	O
know	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
is	O
that	O
Burns	O
is	O
a	O
very	O
exciting	O
area.	O
It	O
is	O
abundantly	O
clear	O
that	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
metal	O
we	O
have	O
found	O
already	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
our	O
exploration	O
has	O
been	O
limited	O
to	O
date	O
,	O
shows	O
that	O
we	O
have	O
only	O
scratched	O
the	O
surface	O
of	O
what	O
we	O
will	O
define	O
in	O
the	O
Burns	O
area.	O

could	O

tonnage	O
,	O
low	O
to	O
medium	O
grade	O
open	O
pittable	O
Cu/Au	O

western	O
basalt	O

Au	O

PRINCIPAL	O
ACTIVITIES	O
The	O
principal	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
during	O
the	O
year	O
were	O
:	O
•	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
of	O
the	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
(	O
LGP	O
)	O
,	O
50km	O
south	O
east	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
−	O

At	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
,	O
the	O
major	O
exploration	O
effort	O
focus	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
during	O
2021	O
was	O
at	O
the	O
Burns	O
prospect	O
,	O
subsequent	O
to	O
the	O
tenement	O
being	O
granted	O
in	O
September	O
2020	O
.	O

The	O
exploration	O
involved	O
reverse	O
circulation	O
(	O
RC	O
)	O
and	O
diamond	O
drill-based	O
exploration	O
that	O
identified	O
an	O
exciting	O
new	O
gold	O
,	O
copper	O
and	O
silver	O
mineral	O
system	O
hosted	O
by	O
porphyry	O
and	O
basalt	O
at	O
Burns.	O
Aircore	O
(	O
AC	O
)	O
drilling	O
programs	O
were	O
completed	O
in	O
the	O
first	O
half	O
of	O
FY21	O
at	O
Havelock	O
and	O
along	O
the	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
trend.	O
A	O
large	O
auger	O
drill	O
program	O
was	O
completed	O
covering	O
a	O
15km	O
trend	O
from	O
Hang	O
Glider	O
Hill	O
to	O
Lucky	O
Strike.	O
−	O

At	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
a	O
Farm	O
In	O
and	O
Joint	O
Venture	O
Agreement	O
(	O

Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
objectives	O
with	O
shareholder	O
and	O
business	O
objectives	O
by	O
providing	O
a	O
fixed	O
remuneration	O
component	O
and	O
offering	O
long-term	O
incentives	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate.	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
believes	O
the	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
is	O
effective	O
in	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitable	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
to	O
manage	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
activities.	O
The	O
board	O
will	O
review	O
executive	O
packages	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
considers	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
its	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
and	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
performance	O
,	O
executive	O
performance	O
and	O
comparable	O
information	O
from	O
industry	O
sectors	O
and	O
other	O
listed	O
companies	O
in	O
similar	O
industries.	O
The	O
Board	O
may	O
exercise	O
discretion	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
approving	O
incentives	O
,	O
bonuses	O
and	O
shares	O
under	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Share	O
Plan	O
Trust	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O
The	O
policy	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
for	O
performance	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
long-term	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O
The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
the	O

guarantee	O
contribution	O
required	O
by	O
the	O
government	O
of	O
Australia	O

which	O
was	O
9.5%	O
for	O
the	O
2021	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
entitled	O
to	O
receive	O
any	O
other	O
retirement	O
benefits.	O
The	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
at	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
comparable	O
companies	O
for	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O

Board	O

to	O

directors	O
and	O
reviews	O
their	O
remuneration	O
annually	O

on	O
market	O
practice	O
,	O
duties	O
and	O
accountability.	O
Independent	O

advice	O
is	O
sought	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
required.	O

’	O

1	O
:	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consisting	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
“	O
the	O
Group	O
”	O
or	O
“	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars.	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
,	O
incorporated	O
in	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
laws	O
of	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands	O
on	O
14	O
May	O
1990	O
under	O
the	O
BVI	O
Business	O
Companies	O
Act.	O
The	O
Company	O
maintains	O
registered	O
offices	O
in	O
Western	O
Australian	O
and	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
on	O
29	O
September	O
2021.	O
The	O
directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
“	O
IFRS	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
“	O
IASB	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
The	O
Group	O
applied	O
all	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
that	O
were	O
effective	O
1	O
July	O
2020	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
Amendments	O
on	O
IFRS	O
3	O
–	O

Definition	O
of	O
a	O
Business	O
Amendments	O
to	O
IFRS	O
3	O
to	O
clarify	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
,	O
assisting	O
entities	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
a	O
transaction	O
should	O
be	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
or	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
acquisition.	O
The	O
amendments	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
clarify	O
that	O
to	O
be	O
considered	O
a	O
business	O
,	O
an	O
acquired	O
set	O
of	O
activities	O
and	O
assets	O
must	O
include	O
,	O
at	O
a	O
minimum	O
,	O
an	O
input	O
and	O
a	O
substantive	O
process	O
that	O
together	O
significantly	O
contribute	O
to	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
create	O
outputs	O
;	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
remove	O
the	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
market	O
participants	O
are	O
capable	O
of	O
replacing	O
any	O
missing	O
inputs	O
or	O
processes	O
and	O
continuing	O
to	O
produce	O
outputs	O
;	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
add	O
guidance	O
and	O
illustrative	O
examples	O
to	O
help	O
entities	O
assess	O
whether	O
a	O
substantive	O
process	O
has	O
been	O
acquired	O
;	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
narrow	O
the	O
definitions	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
and	O
of	O
outputs	O
by	O
focusing	O
on	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
customers	O
and	O
by	O
removing	O
the	O
reference	O
to	O
an	O
ability	O
to	O
reduce	O
costs	O
;	O
and	O
(	O
e	O
)	O
add	O
an	O
optional	O
concentration	O
test	O
that	O
permits	O
a	O
simplified	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
an	O
acquired	O
set	O
of	O
activities	O
and	O
assets	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
business.	O
The	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
3	O
has	O
not	O

of	O
the	O

,	O
to	O

the	O

•	O

The	O

to	O

over	O
the	O
investee	O
to	O
affect	O
its	O
return	O
When	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
less	O
than	O
a	O

of	O

of	O
an	O

and	O

in	O

•	O

of	O
the	O

•	O

Rights	O
arising	O
from	O
other	O

arrangements	O
•	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
voting	O
rights	O
and	O
potential	O
voting	O
rights	O
The	O
Group	O

whether	O

it	O
controls	O
an	O

if	O

are	O

on	O
which	O
the	O
Group	O
obtains	O
control	O
over	O

and	O

,	O

and	O

on	O

between	O
Group	O

are	O

are	O
also	O

unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O

policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
aligned	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Changes	O
in	O
ownership	O
interests	O
The	O
Group	O
treats	O
transactions	O
with	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
as	O
transactions	O
with	O
equity	O
owners	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
results	O
in	O
an	O
adjustment	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
Page	O
29	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
the	O
controlling	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
to	O
reflect	O
their	O
relative	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary.	O
Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
adjustment	O
to	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
and	O
any	O

received	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
a	O
separate	O

within	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O

of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited.	O

in	O

amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O

The	O

value	O
is	O

initial	O

of	O

for	O

joint	O
venture	O
or	O
other	O

asset	O

for	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
IFRS	O
9.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
any	O
amounts	O

recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
that	O
entity	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
if	O
the	O
group	O
had	O
directly	O
disposed	O
of	O
the	O
related	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities.	O
This	O
may	O
mean	O
that	O
amounts	O
previously	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
reclassified	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
an	O
entity	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O
earn	O
revenues	O
and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
whose	O
operating	O
results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
entity's	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O
Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker.	O
The	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
,	O
who	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
allocating	O
resources	O
and	O
assessing	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors.	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
The	O
income	O
tax	O
expense	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
is	O
the	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
’	O
s	O
taxable	O
income	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
applicable	O
income	O
tax	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction	O
adjusted	O
by	O
changes	O
in	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
attributable	O
to	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
to	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses.	O
The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
charge	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
tax	O
laws	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
the	O
countries	O
where	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
operate	O
and	O
generate	O
taxable	O
income.	O
Management	O
periodically	O
evaluates	O
positions	O
taken	O
in	O
tax	O
returns	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
situations	O
in	O
which	O
applicable	O
tax	O
regulation	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interpretation.	O
It	O
establishes	O
provisions	O
where	O
appropriate	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authorities.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
on	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
between	O
the	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
not	O
accounted	O
for	O
if	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
other	O
than	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
that	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
affects	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
determined	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
when	O
the	O
related	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
asset	O
is	O
realised	O
or	O
a	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
settled.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
investments	O
in	O
controlled	O
entities	O
where	O
the	O
parent	O
entity	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Current	O
and	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
balances	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
In	O
this	O
case	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
is	O
also	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
respectively.	O

)	O
Leases	O

Group	O

of	O
lease	O

the	O

less	O

and	O
the	O

Impairment	O
of	O
non-current	O
assets	O
Non-current	O
assets	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
impairment	O
whenever	O
events	O
or	O
changes	O
in	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
recoverable.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
amount	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
assessing	O
impairment	O
,	O
assets	O
are	O
grouped	O
at	O
the	O
lowest	O
levels	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
separately	O
identifiable	O
cash	O
inflows	O
which	O
are	O
largely	O
independent	O

the	O
cash	O

other	O
assets	O
or	O
groups	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
cash-	O

)	O

Non-financial	O
assets	O
that	O

possible	O

of	O

Cash	O

Financial	O
instruments	O
Financial	O
assets	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
(	O
OCI	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O
The	O
classification	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
contractual	O
cashflow	O
characteristics	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
them.	O
With	O
the	O
exception	O
of	O
the	O
Groups	O
trade	O
receivables	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O
significant	O
financing	O
component	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
initially	O
measures	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
at	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
plus	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
not	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O
,	O
less	O
transaction	O
costs.	O
Receivables	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
In	O
order	O
for	O
a	O
receivable	O
to	O
be	O
classified	O
and	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
it	O
needs	O
to	O
give	O
rise	O
to	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
‘	O
solely	O
payments	O
of	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
on	O
the	O
principal	O
amount	O
outstanding.	O
For	O

assets	O

are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O
The	O

cost	O
is	O
reduced	O
by	O
impairment	O
losses.	O
For	O
short	O
term	O
receivables	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
based	O
on	O
lifetime	O
ECLs	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O
In	O

the	O
provision	O
required	O

Group	O
utilises	O
its	O

credit	O
loss	O
experience	O
,	O
adjusted	O
only	O
where	O
appropriate	O
for	O
forward-looking	O
factors	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
debtors	O
and	O
economic	O
environment.	O
The	O
Group	O

indicates	O
that	O

)	O
the	O
Group	O

A	O

written	O

there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O

of	O

that	O

assets	O

through	O

or	O
loss	O
Financial	O
assets	O
classified	O
at	O
“	O

through	O

or	O
loss	O
”	O
include	O

assets	O

for	O

designated	O
upon	O
initial	O
recognition	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
or	O

assets	O

required	O
to	O
be	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
acquired	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
selling	O
or	O

in	O
the	O
near	O
term.	O
Derivatives	O
,	O
including	O
separated	O
embedded	O
derivatives	O
,	O
are	O
also	O
classified	O
as	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
unless	O
they	O
are	O
designated	O
as	O
effective	O
hedging	O
instruments.	O
The	O
group	O
holds	O
equity	O
investments	O
which	O
are	O
mandatorily	O
classified	O
as	O
“	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
”	O
.	O

Such	O
assets	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
with	O
changes	O
in	O
carrying	O
amount	O
being	O
included	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
the	O
price	O
the	O
Group	O
would	O
receive	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
pay	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
independent	O
,	O
knowledgeable	O
and	O
willing	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
All	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
stated	O
at	O
historical	O
cost	O
less	O
accumulated	O
depreciation	O
and	O
accumulated	O
impairment.	O
Historical	O
cost	O
includes	O
expenditure	O
that	O
is	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
items.	O
Subsequent	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
or	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
,	O
only	O
when	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
economic	O
benefits	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
item	O
will	O
flow	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
item	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
The	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
any	O
component	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
is	O
derecognised	O
when	O
replaced.	O
All	O
other	O
repairs	O
and	O
maintenance	O
are	O
charged	O
to	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
during	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O
Depreciation	O
of	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
the	O
straight-line	O
method	O
to	O
allocate	O
their	O
cost	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
their	O
residual	O
values	O
,	O
over	O
their	O
estimated	O
useful	O
lives	O
and	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
leasehold	O
improvements	O
,	O
the	O
shorter	O
of	O
lease	O
term	O
and	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
useful	O
life.	O
The	O
rates	O
vary	O
between	O
25%	O
and	O
40%	O
per	O
annum.	O
The	O
assets	O
’	O
residual	O
values	O
and	O
useful	O
lives	O
are	O
reviewed	O
,	O
and	O
adjusted	O
if	O
appropriate	O
,	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O
An	O

’	O
s	O

down	O
immediately	O
to	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
if	O

’	O

amount	O

greater	O
than	O
its	O
estimated	O

amount	O
(	O
note	O
1	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
)	O
.	O

of	O

amount	O
of	O
associated	O
GST	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O

from	O
the	O
taxation	O
authority.	O
In	O
this	O

it	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
inclusive	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable.	O
The	O

of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O

to	O
,	O

taxation	O
authority	O
is	O
included	O
with	O
other	O

in	O

statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O

basis.	O
(	O
p	O
)	O
Non-current	O

Critical	O

,	O

and	O

to	O

of	O

’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies.	O
The	O
areas	O

a	O
higher	O
degree	O
of	O
judgement	O
or	O
complexity	O
,	O
or	O
areas	O

and	O

to	O
the	O

statements	O
are	O
:	O
Rehabilitation	O
provision	O
The	O
ultimate	O
rehabilitation	O
costs	O
are	O
uncertain	O
,	O
and	O
cost	O
estimates	O
can	O
vary	O
in	O
response	O
to	O
many	O
factors	O
,	O
including	O
estimates	O
of	O
the	O
extent	O
and	O
costs	O
of	O
rehabilitation	O
activities	O
,	O
technological	O
changes	O
,	O
regulatory	O
changes	O
and	O
cost	O
increases.	O
These	O
uncertainties	O
may	O
result	O
in	O
future	O
actual	O
expenditure	O
differing	O
from	O
the	O
amounts	O
currently	O
provided.	O
Therefore	O
,	O
significant	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
are	O
made	O
in	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
for	O
rehabilitation.	O
As	O
a	O
result	O
,	O
there	O
could	O
be	O
significant	O
adjustments	O
to	O
the	O
provisions	O
established	O
which	O
would	O
affect	O
future	O
financial	O
results.	O
The	O
provision	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
represents	O
management	O
’	O
s	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
future	O
rehabilitation	O
costs	O
required.	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
costs	O
The	O
application	O
of	O
the	O

policy	O
for	O
exploration	O

to	O

area	O
of	O
interest	O

considered	O

to	O

future	O

or	O
sale	O
or	O
where	O

have	O
not	O

a	O

of	O
the	O

of	O
reserves.	O
This	O
policy	O

to	O
make	O
certain	O
estimates	O
as	O
to	O
future	O
events	O
and	O

,	O
in	O

established.	O

available.	O

to	O

FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O

risk	O
(	O

risk	O

risk	O
and	O

price	O

Risk	O

is	O

by	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
as	O
the	O

that	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
Market	O
risk	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Foreign	O

risk	O
The	O
Group	O
operates	O
entirely	O
in	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O

significantly	O
exposed	O
to	O

risk.	O

)	O

price	O
risk	O

of	O

Group	O

s	O

June	O
2021	O

to	O

risk.	O
(	O
iii	O
)	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
movements	O
in	O
market	O

rates	O
on	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O

Group	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
monitor	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
yield	O
curve	O
out	O
to	O
six	O
months	O
to	O
ensure	O
a	O

is	O

between	O

of	O
cash	O
assets	O
and	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
return.	O
The	O

of	O

and	O

for	O

Group	O
of	O
$3	O
,	O
354	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
$907	O

000	O
)	O

risk.	O

(	O

)	O
.	O

)	O

)	O

Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
Group	O
defines	O
capital	O
as	O
issued	O
share	O
capital.	O
Its	O
objective	O
when	O

capital	O
is	O
to	O

its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
may	O
strive	O
to	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
stakeholders.	O

to	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
,	O
being	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
ready	O
access	O
to	O
credit	O
facilities	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
primary	O
source	O
of	O

raisings.	O

for	O

opinion.	O
The	O
risk	O
of	O
not	O
detecting	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
resulting	O
from	O
fraud	O
is	O
higher	O
than	O
for	O
one	O
resulting	O
from	O
error	O
,	O
as	O
fraud	O
may	O
involve	O
collusion	O
,	O
forgery	O
,	O
intentional	O
omissions	O
,	O
misrepresentations	O
,	O
or	O

override	O
of	O
internal	O
control.	O

mem	O
ber	O
firm	O

►	O

Obtain	O
an	O
understanding	O
of	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O

audit	O
in	O

to	O

’	O

►	O

Evaluate	O

on	O

directors	O

of	O

basis	O

,	O

audit	O
evidence	O
obtained	O
,	O
whether	O

material	O

exists	O

or	O

as	O
a	O
going	O

Obtain	O

audit.	O

Corporate	O
Governance	O

Governance.	O

is	O

to	O

for	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O

with	O

RED	O
DALE-Mineral	O
Resource	O
Estimate	O
The	O
Red	O
Dale	O
deposit	O
is	O
situated	O
within	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
located	O
approximately	O
60km	O
to	O
the	O
south	O
east	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
,	O
Western	O
Australia.	O
The	O
resource	O
is	O
situated	O
wholly	O
within	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
granted	O
Mining	O
lease	O
M25/362.	O
The	O
Company	O
enagaged	O
Resource	O
Evaluation	O
Services	O
in	O
2020	O
to	O
compile	O
the	O
Resource.	O
The	O
Company	O
announced	O
the	O
Resource	O
to	O
the	O
ASX	O
on	O
3	O
June	O
2020	O
and	O
reported	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
JORC	O
2012.	O
The	O
Company	O
confirms	O
Page	O
56	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
no	O
exploration	O
activity	O
,	O
including	O
resource	O
compilation	O
at	O
the	O
Red	O
Dale	O
Deposit	O
since	O
3	O
June	O
2020	O
that	O
would	O
alter	O
the	O
Resource	O
Statement.	O
The	O
Mineral	O
Resources	O
estimate	O
was	O
compiled	O
using	O
standard	O
industry	O
methodology	O
using	O
geological	O
interpretation	O
,	O
assay	O
results	O
from	O
reverse	O
circulation	O
and	O
diamond	O
drilling	O
,	O
downhole	O
and	O
surface	O
surveys	O
collected	O
by	O
employee	O
’	O
s	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O
The	O
Mineral	O
Resource	O
estimate	O
was	O
overseen	O
by	O
a	O
suitably	O
qualified	O
LEX	O
personnel	O
and	O
completed	O
by	O
a	O
consultant	O
who	O
has	O
sufficient	O
experience	O
to	O
qualify	O
as	O
a	O
Competant	O
Person.	O
The	O
Mineral	O
Resources	O
Statement	O
included	O
in	O
each	O
Company	O
document	O
is	O
reviewed	O
and	O
approved	O
by	O
a	O
suitably	O
qualified	O
Competant	O
Person	O
prior	O
to	O
its	O
announcement.	O
Competent	O
Persons	O
Statement	O
The	O
information	O
in	O
this	O
report	O
that	O
relates	O
to	O
the	O
Sampling	O
Techniques	O
and	O
Data	O
and	O
Reporting	O
of	O
Exploration	O
Results	O
for	O
the	O
Red	O
Dale	O
deposit	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
,	O
and	O
fairly	O
represents	O
,	O
information	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
compiled	O
by	O
employees	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
under	O
the	O
supervision	O
and	O
guidance	O
of	O
Mr.	O
Wayne	O
Carter	O
,	O
Senior	O
Exploration	O

at	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
and	O
Member	O
of	O
the	O
Australasian	O
Institute	O
of	O
Geoscientists.	O
Mr.	O
Carter	O
has	O
sufficient	O
experience	O
that	O
is	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
style	O
of	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
type	O
of	O
deposit	O
under	O

the	O
activity	O
that	O

being	O

to	O

as	O

Person	O
as	O
defined	O
in	O
the	O
2012	O

of	O
the	O
‘	O

Code	O
for	O
Reporting	O
of	O
Exploration	O

,	O
Mineral	O

and	O
Ore	O
Reserves.	O
Mr.	O
Carter	O
consents	O

inclusion	O
in	O

matters	O

on	O
his	O
information	O

and	O

.	O

,	O

LUCKY	O
STRIKE-Mineral	O
Resource	O
Estimate	O
The	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
deposit	O
is	O
situated	O
within	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
located	O
approximately	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
south	O
east	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
,	O
Western	O
Australia.	O
The	O
resource	O
is	O
situated	O
wholly	O
within	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
granted	O
Mining	O
lease	O
M25/366.	O
The	O
Company	O
engaged	O
Resource	O
Evaluation	O
Services	O
in	O
2020	O
to	O
complete	O
the	O
Mineral	O
Resource	O
estimate.	O
The	O
Company	O
announced	O
the	O
Resource	O
to	O
the	O
ASX	O
on	O
20	O
May	O
2020	O
and	O
reported	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
JORC	O
2012.	O
The	O
Company	O
confirms	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
no	O
exploration	O
activity	O
,	O
including	O
resource	O
compilation	O
at	O
the	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
Deposit	O
since	O
20	O
May	O
2020	O
that	O
would	O
alter	O
the	O
Resource	O
Statement.	O
The	O
Mineral	O
Resources	O
estimate	O
was	O
compiled	O
using	O
standard	O
industry	O
methodology	O
using	O
geological	O
interpretation	O
,	O

in	O

terms	O

continues	O
to	O
play	O
its	O

as	O

EXPLORATION	O
OVERVIEW	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
(	O
‘	O
LGP	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
some	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
South	O
East	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Goldfields	O
Province	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
project.	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
is	O
wholly	O
owned	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O
The	O
commanding	O
,	O
semi-contiguous	O
,	O
granted	O
land	O
package	O
covers	O
598km2	O
immediately	O
east	O
of	O
and	O
adjoining	O
the	O
world	O
class	O
St	O
Ives	O
Gold	O
camp	O
,	O
operated	O
by	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
Limited	O
(	O
NYSE	O
:	O
GFI	O
)	O
(	O
“	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
immediately	O
south	O
of	O
the	O
high-grade	O
Mt	O
Monger	O
gold	O
centre	O
operated	O
by	O
Silver	O
Lake	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
SLR	O
)	O
.	O

Four	O
gold	O
processing	O
operations	O
are	O
strategically	O
located	O
within	O
50km	O

Directors	O
will	O
be	O
subject	O
to	O
shareholder	O
approval	O
at	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O

of	O

or	O

LIKELY	O

ENVIRONMENTAL	O
REGULATION	O
AND	O
PERFORMANCE	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
significant	O
environmental	O
regulation	O
in	O
respect	O
to	O
its	O
exploration	O
activities.	O
The	O
Group	O
aims	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
appropriate	O
standard	O
of	O
environmental	O
care	O
is	O
achieved	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
doing	O
so	O
,	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
aware	O
of	O
and	O
is	O
in	O
compliance	O
with	O
all	O
environmental	O
legislation.	O

directors	O
of	O
the	O

are	O
not	O

of	O
any	O

of	O

for	O

under	O

(	O
Managing	O
Director	O
)	O
Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
has	O
been	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
objectives	O
with	O
shareholder	O
and	O
business	O
objectives	O
by	O
providing	O
a	O
fixed	O
remuneration	O
component	O
and	O
offering	O
long-term	O
incentives	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate.	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
believes	O
the	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
to	O
be	O
appropriate	O
and	O
effective	O
in	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitable	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
to	O
run	O
and	O
manage	O
the	O
Group.	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
,	O
setting	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
for	O
the	O
Managing	O
Director	O
,	O
was	O
developed	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
a	O
base	O
salary	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
factors	O
such	O
as	O
experience	O
)	O
and	O
superannuation.	O
The	O
board	O
will	O
review	O
executive	O
packages	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
considers	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
its	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
and	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
performance	O
,	O
executive	O
performance	O
and	O
comparable	O
information	O
from	O
industry	O
sectors	O
and	O
other	O
listed	O
companies	O
in	O
similar	O
industries.	O
The	O
Board	O
may	O
exercise	O
discretion	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
approving	O
incentives	O
,	O
bonuses	O
and	O
shares	O
under	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Share	O
Plan	O
Trust	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O
The	O
policy	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
for	O
performance	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
long-term	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O
The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
the	O
superannuation	O
guarantee	O
contribution	O
required	O
by	O
the	O
government	O
of	O
Australia	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
9.5%	O
for	O
the	O
2019	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
entitled	O
to	O
receive	O
any	O
other	O
retirement	O
benefits.	O
The	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
at	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
comparable	O
companies	O
for	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O
The	O
Board	O
determines	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
and	O
reviews	O
their	O
remuneration	O
annually	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
practice	O
,	O
duties	O
and	O
accountability.	O
Independent	O
external	O
advice	O
is	O
sought	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
required.	O
To	O
align	O
directors	O
’	O
interests	O
with	O
shareholder	O
interests	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
hold	O
shares	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
Performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
The	O
Group	O
utilises	O
performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
motivate	O
directors	O
and	O
employees	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Ltd	O
Share	O
Plan	O
which	O
was	O
approved	O
by	O
shareholders	O
on	O
12	O
September	O
2016.	O
Where	O
utilised	O
,	O
shares	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Plan	O
do	O
not	O
vest	O
until	O
certain	O
hurdles	O
have	O
been	O
met.	O
The	O
hurdles	O
are	O
based	O
around	O
future	O
events	O
that	O
will	O
advance	O
the	O
Company	O
towards	O
its	O
objectives.	O
Use	O
of	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O

did	O
not	O

the	O
services	O
of	O
any	O

consultants	O

above	O
Consolidated	O
Statement	O
of	O
Cash	O

should	O

read	O
in	O
conjunction	O
with	O
the	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Financial	O
Statements.	O
Page	O
25	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
1	O
:	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consisting	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
“	O
the	O
Group	O
”	O
or	O
“	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars.	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
,	O
incorporated	O
in	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
laws	O
of	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands	O
on	O
14	O
May	O
1990	O
under	O
the	O
International	O
Business	O
Act	O
(	O
Cap.	O
291	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
maintains	O
registered	O
offices	O
in	O
Western	O
Australian	O
and	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
on	O
27	O
September	O
2019.	O
The	O
directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
“	O
IFRS	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
“	O
IASB	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
IFRS	O
15	O
Revenue	O
from	O
Contracts	O
with	O
Customers	O
IFRS	O
15	O
and	O
its	O
related	O
amendments	O
supersede	O
IAS	O
11	O
Construction	O
Contracts	O
,	O
IAS	O
18	O
Revenue	O
and	O
related	O
Interpretations.	O
It	O
applies	O
to	O
all	O
revenue	O
arising	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
its	O
customers	O
and	O
became	O
effective	O
for	O
annual	O
periods	O
beginning	O
on	O
or	O
after	O
1	O
January	O
2018.	O
IFRS	O
15	O
establishes	O
a	O
five-step	O
model	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
revenue	O
arising	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers.	O
It	O
requires	O
revenue	O
to	O
be	O
recognised	O
when	O
(	O
or	O
as	O
)	O
control	O
of	O
a	O
good	O
or	O
service	O
transfers	O
to	O
a	O
customer	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
consideration	O
to	O
which	O
an	O
entity	O
expects	O
to	O
be	O
entitled	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
transferring	O
goods	O
or	O
services	O
to	O
a	O
customer.	O
IFRS	O
15	O
requires	O
entities	O
to	O
exercise	O
judgement	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
consideration	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
relevant	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
when	O
applying	O
each	O
step	O
of	O
the	O
model	O
to	O
contracts	O
with	O
their	O
customers.	O
The	O
standard	O
also	O
specifies	O
the	O
accounting	O
for	O
the	O
incremental	O
costs	O
of	O
obtaining	O
a	O
contract	O
and	O
the	O
costs	O
directly	O
related	O
to	O
fulfilling	O
a	O
contract.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
the	O
standard	O
requires	O
enhanced	O
and	O
extensive	O
disclosures	O
about	O
revenue	O
to	O
help	O
investors	O
better	O
understand	O
the	O
nature	O
,	O
amount	O
,	O
timing	O
and	O
uncertainty	O
of	O
revenue	O
and	O
cash	O
flows	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers.	O
The	O
Group	O
adopted	O
IFRS	O
15	O
using	O
the	O
full	O
retrospective	O
method	O
of	O
adoption.	O
The	O
change	O
did	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
material	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
as	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
revenue	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers.	O
There	O
was	O
no	O
net	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows.	O
There	O
was	O
no	O
impact	O
on	O
EPS.	O
IFRS	O
9	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
Measurement	O
and	O
classification	O
IFRS	O
9	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
replaces	O
IAS	O
39	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
:	O
Recognition	O
and	O
Measurement	O
for	O
annual	O
periods	O
beginning	O
on	O
or	O
after	O
1	O
January	O
2018	O
,	O
bringing	O
together	O
all	O
three	O
aspects	O
of	O
the	O
accounting	O
for	O
financial	O
instruments	O
:	O
classification	O
and	O
measurement	O
;	O
impairment	O
;	O
and	O
hedge	O
accounting.	O
Under	O
IFRS	O
9	O
,	O
debt	O
instruments	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O

.	O

through	O
its	O
power	O

Specifically	O

Gorup	O
controls	O
a	O

if	O

and	O
only	O
if	O
,	O

Group	O
has	O
:	O
	O

Power	O
over	O

(	O
ie.	O

that	O

to	O

of	O
the	O
investee	O
)	O
	O

Exposure	O
,	O
or	O
rights	O
,	O
to	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
investee	O
	O

The	O
ability	O
to	O
use	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee	O
to	O
affect	O
its	O
return	O
When	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
less	O
than	O
a	O
majority	O
of	O
the	O
voting	O
or	O
similar	O
rights	O
of	O
an	O
investee	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
considers	O
all	O
relevant	O
facts	O
and	O
ciscumstances	O
in	O

whether	O
has	O

over	O
an	O
investee	O

:	O
	O

The	O
contractual	O
arrangement	O
with	O
the	O
other	O
vote	O
holders	O
of	O
the	O
investee	O
	O

Rights	O
arising	O
from	O
other	O
contractual	O
arrangements	O
	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
voting	O
rights	O
and	O
potential	O
voting	O
rights	O
The	O
Group	O
re-assesses	O
whether	O
or	O
not	O
it	O
controls	O
an	O
investee	O
if	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
changes	O
to	O
one	O
of	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
three	O
elements	O
of	O
control.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
the	O
Group	O
obtains	O
control	O
over	O
the	O
subsidiary	O
and	O
ceases	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
loses	O
control.	O
The	O
acquisition	O
method	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
business	O
combinations	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O
Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
between	O
Group	O
companies	O
are	O
eliminated.	O
Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Changes	O
in	O
ownership	O
interests	O
The	O
Group	O
treats	O
transactions	O
with	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
as	O
transactions	O
with	O
equity	O
owners	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
results	O
in	O
an	O
adjustment	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
the	O
controlling	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
to	O
reflect	O
their	O
relative	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary.	O
Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
adjustment	O
to	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
and	O
any	O
consideration	O
paid	O
or	O
received	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
a	O
separate	O
reserve	O
within	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O
owners	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited.	O
When	O
the	O
Group	O
ceases	O
to	O
have	O
control	O
,	O
any	O
retained	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
entity	O
is	O
remeasured	O
to	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
with	O
the	O
change	O
in	O
carrying	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
the	O
initial	O
carrying	O
amount	O
for	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
subsequently	O
accounting	O
for	O
the	O
retained	O
interest	O
as	O
an	O
associate	O
,	O
jointly	O
controlled	O
entity	O
or	O
financial	O
asset.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
any	O
amounts	O
previously	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
that	O
entity	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
if	O
the	O
group	O
had	O
directly	O
disposed	O
of	O
the	O
related	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities.	O
This	O
may	O
mean	O
that	O
amounts	O
previously	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
reclassified	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
an	O
entity	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O
earn	O
revenues	O
and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
whose	O
operating	O
results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
entity's	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O
Page	O
28	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker.	O
The	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
,	O
who	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
allocating	O
resources	O
and	O
assessing	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors.	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
The	O
income	O
tax	O
expense	O
or	O
revenue	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
is	O
the	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
’	O
s	O
taxable	O
income	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
applicable	O
income	O
tax	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction	O
adjusted	O
by	O
changes	O
in	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
attributable	O
to	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
to	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses.	O
The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
charge	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
tax	O
laws	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
the	O
countries	O
where	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
and	O
associated	O
operate	O
and	O
generate	O
taxable	O
income.	O
Management	O
periodically	O
evaluates	O
positions	O
taken	O
in	O
tax	O
returns	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
situations	O
in	O
which	O
applicable	O
tax	O
regulation	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interpretation.	O
It	O
establishes	O
provisions	O
where	O
appropriate	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authorities.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
on	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
between	O
the	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
not	O
accounted	O
for	O
if	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
other	O
than	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
that	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
affects	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
determined	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantially	O
enacted	O
by	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
when	O
the	O
related	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
asset	O
is	O
realised	O
or	O
a	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
settled.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
investments	O
in	O
controlled	O
entities	O
where	O
the	O
parent	O
entity	O
is	O

to	O
control	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O

reversal	O
of	O

and	O

is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Current	O
and	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
a	O

to	O
offset	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O

deferred	O

relate	O

the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O

either	O

on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O

liability	O
simultaneously.	O
Current	O
and	O

tax	O
is	O

in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
to	O
the	O

to	O
items	O

other	O

in	O

In	O

)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
non-current	O
assets	O
Non-current	O
assets	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
impairment	O
whenever	O
events	O
or	O
changes	O
in	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
recoverable.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
amount	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
assessing	O
impairment	O
,	O
assets	O
are	O
grouped	O
at	O
the	O
lowest	O
levels	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
separately	O
identifiable	O
cash	O
inflows	O
which	O
are	O
largely	O
independent	O
of	O
the	O
cash	O
inflows	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
or	O
groups	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
units	O
)	O
.	O

assets	O
that	O

are	O

for	O
possible	O
reversal	O
of	O

date.	O
(	O
g	O
)	O
Cash	O
and	O

equivalents	O

Financial	O
instruments	O
Financial	O
assets	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
(	O
OCI	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O
The	O
classification	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
contractual	O
cashflow	O
characteristics	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
them.	O
With	O
the	O
exception	O
of	O
the	O
Groups	O
trade	O
receivables	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O
significant	O
financing	O
component	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
initially	O
measures	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
at	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
plus	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
not	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O
,	O
less	O
transaction	O
costs.	O
Trade	O
Receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O
significant	O
financing	O
component	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
transaction	O
price	O
determined	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
revenue	O
recognition.	O
For	O
trade	O
receivables	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
applies	O
a	O
simplified	O
approach	O
in	O
calculating	O
ECLs.	O
Therefore	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
track	O
changes	O
in	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
but	O
instead	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
based	O
on	O
lifetime	O
ECLs	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O
In	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
required	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
utilises	O
its	O
historical	O
credit	O
loss	O
experience	O
,	O
adjusted	O
only	O
where	O
appropriate	O
for	O
forward-looking	O
factors	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
debtors	O
and	O
economic	O
environment.	O
The	O
Group	O
considers	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
default	O
when	O
contractual	O
payments	O
are	O
90	O
days	O
past	O
due.	O
However	O
,	O
in	O
certain	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
may	O
also	O
consider	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
to	O
be	O
in	O
default	O
when	O
internal	O
or	O
external	O
information	O
indicates	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
unlikely	O
to	O
receive	O
the	O
outstanding	O
contractual	O
amounts	O
in	O
full	O
before	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
any	O
credit	O
enhancements	O
held	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O
A	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
written	O
off	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovery.	O
Indicators	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovery	O
include	O
,	O
amongst	O
others	O
,	O
the	O
failure	O
of	O
a	O
debtor	O
to	O
engage	O
in	O
a	O
repayment	O
plan	O
with	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
failure	O
to	O
make	O
contractual	O
payments	O
for	O
a	O
period	O
of	O
greater	O
than	O
120	O
days	O
past	O
due.	O
There	O
are	O
no	O
material	O
trade	O
receivable	O
for	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
it	O
does	O
not	O

revenues.	O
Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
at	O
“	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
”	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O

“	O

through	O

or	O
loss	O

value.	O
Financial	O

for	O

if	O

acquired	O
for	O

.	O

Such	O

in	O

or	O
loss.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O

the	O

to	O

i	O
)	O
Plant	O
and	O

acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
items.	O

asset	O
’	O
s	O

)	O

at	O
balance	O
date.	O
No	O

.	O

asset.	O

’	O

17.	O
Impact	O
on	O

Exploration	O
Limited	O

’	O

risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
financial	O
loss	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
customer	O
or	O
counterparty	O
to	O
a	O
financial	O
instrument	O
fails	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
contractual	O
obligations.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
credit	O
risk	O
exposure	O
arises	O
principally	O
from	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O
The	O
maximum	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
at	O
balance	O
date	O
is	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
allowance	O
account	O
)	O
of	O
those	O
assets	O
as	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
Credit	O
risk	O
related	O
to	O
balances	O
with	O
banks	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
institutions	O
is	O
managed	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
by	O
holding	O
surplus	O
cash	O
holdings	O
with	O
reputable	O
financial	O
institutions	O
which	O
maintain	O
high	O
credit	O
ratings.	O
All	O
surplus	O
cash	O
holdings	O
within	O
the	O
Group	O
are	O
currently	O
invested	O
with	O
AA-	O
rated	O
financial	O
institutions.	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
assessed	O
the	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
determines	O
the	O
probability	O
of	O
default	O
to	O
be	O
insignificant.	O
Accordingly	O
,	O
no	O
impairment	O
allowance	O
has	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O

or	O

Level	O

than	O

1	O
that	O

(	O

)	O

(	O
derived	O
from	O
prices	O
)	O
.	O

3	O
:	O

fair	O
value	O
is	O

using	O
valuation	O

for	O
which	O

level	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O

value	O

to	O

in	O
dividends	O
and	O

one	O

for	O
each	O
share	O
held.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
Group	O
defines	O
capital	O
as	O
issued	O
share	O
capital.	O
Its	O
objective	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
is	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
may	O
strive	O
to	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
stakeholders.	O
Due	O
to	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
,	O
being	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
ready	O
access	O
to	O
credit	O
facilities	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
primary	O
source	O
of	O
funding	O
being	O
equity	O
raisings.	O
Therefore	O
,	O
the	O
focus	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
capital	O
risk	O
management	O
is	O
the	O
current	O
working	O
capital	O
position	O
against	O
the	O
requirements	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
meet	O
exploration	O
programmes	O
and	O
corporate	O
overheads.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
strategy	O
is	O
to	O
ensure	O
appropriate	O
liquidity	O
is	O
maintained	O
to	O
meet	O
anticipated	O
operating	O
requirements	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
view	O
to	O
initiating	O
appropriate	O
capital	O
raisings	O
as	O
required.	O
The	O
working	O
capital	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
at	O
30	O

responsible	O
for	O
assessing	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
disclosing	O
,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
matters	O
relating	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
unless	O
the	O
directors	O
either	O
intend	O
to	O
liquidate	O
the	O
Group	O
or	O
to	O
cease	O
operations	O
,	O
or	O
have	O
no	O
realistic	O
alternative	O
but	O
to	O
do	O
so.	O
Auditor's	O
responsibilities	O
for	O
the	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
Our	O
objectives	O
are	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
issue	O
an	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
that	O
includes	O
our	O
opinion.	O
Reasonable	O
assurance	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
level	O
of	O
assurance	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
guarantee	O
that	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
International	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
will	O
always	O
detect	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
when	O
it	O
exists.	O
Misstatements	O
can	O
arise	O
from	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
and	O
are	O
considered	O
material	O
if	O
,	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
they	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
economic	O
decisions	O
of	O
users	O
taken	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
this	O
financial	O
report.	O
As	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
audit	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
International	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
,	O
we	O
exercise	O
professional	O
judgment	O
and	O
maintain	O
professional	O
scepticism	O
throughout	O
the	O
audit.	O
We	O
also	O
:	O
►	O

Identify	O
and	O
assess	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
design	O
and	O
perform	O
audit	O
procedures	O
responsive	O
to	O
those	O
risks	O
,	O
and	O
obtain	O
audit	O
evidence	O
that	O
is	O
sufficient	O
and	O
appropriate	O
to	O
provide	O
a	O
basis	O
for	O
our	O
opinion.	O
The	O
risk	O
of	O
not	O
detecting	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
resulting	O
from	O
fraud	O
is	O
higher	O
than	O
for	O
one	O
resulting	O
from	O
error	O
,	O
as	O
fraud	O
may	O
involve	O
collusion	O
,	O
forgery	O
,	O
intentional	O
omissions	O
,	O
misrepresentations	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
override	O
of	O
internal	O
control.	O
►	O

Obtain	O
an	O
understanding	O
of	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
audit	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
design	O
audit	O
procedures	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
expressing	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
effectiveness	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
internal	O
control.	O
►	O

Evaluate	O
the	O
appropriateness	O
of	O
accounting	O
policies	O
used	O
and	O
the	O
reasonableness	O
of	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
related	O
disclosures	O
made	O
by	O
the	O
directors.	O
A	O
member	O
firm	O
of	O
Ernst	O
&	O
Young	O
Global	O
Limited	O
Liability	O
limited	O
by	O
a	O
scheme	O
approved	O
under	O
Professional	O
Standards	O
Legislation	O
►	O

Conclude	O
on	O
the	O
appropriateness	O
of	O
the	O
directors	O
’	O
use	O
of	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
and	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
audit	O
evidence	O
obtained	O
,	O
whether	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
exists	O
related	O
to	O
events	O
or	O
conditions	O
that	O
may	O
cast	O
significant	O
doubt	O
on	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O
If	O
we	O
conclude	O
that	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
exists	O
,	O
we	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
draw	O
attention	O
in	O
our	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
to	O
the	O
related	O
disclosures	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
or	O
,	O
if	O
such	O
disclosures	O
are	O
inadequate	O
,	O
to	O
modify	O
our	O
opinion.	O
Our	O
conclusions	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
audit	O
evidence	O
obtained	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
our	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report.	O
However	O
,	O
future	O
events	O
or	O
conditions	O
may	O
cause	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
cease	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O
►	O

Evaluate	O
the	O
overall	O
presentation	O
,	O
structure	O
and	O
content	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
disclosures	O
,	O
and	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
represents	O
the	O
underlying	O
transactions	O
and	O
events	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
that	O
achieves	O
fair	O
presentation.	O
►	O

Obtain	O
sufficient	O
appropriate	O
audit	O
evidence	O
regarding	O
the	O
financial	O
information	O
of	O
the	O
entities	O
or	O
business	O
activities	O
within	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
express	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
We	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
direction	O
,	O
supervision	O
and	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
audit.	O
We	O
remain	O
solely	O
responsible	O
for	O
our	O
audit	O
opinion.	O
We	O
communicate	O
with	O
the	O
directors	O
regarding	O
,	O
among	O
other	O
matters	O
,	O
the	O
planned	O
scope	O
and	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
audit	O
and	O
significant	O
audit	O
findings	O
,	O
including	O
any	O
significant	O
deficiencies	O
in	O
internal	O
control	O
that	O
we	O
identify	O
during	O
our	O
audit.	O
We	O
also	O
provide	O
the	O
directors	O
with	O
a	O
statement	O
that	O
we	O
have	O
complied	O
with	O
relevant	O
ethical	O
requirements	O
regarding	O
independence	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
communicate	O
with	O
them	O
all	O
relationships	O
and	O
other	O
matters	O
that	O
may	O
reasonably	O
be	O
thought	O
to	O
bear	O
on	O
our	O
independence	O
,	O
and	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
related	O
safeguards.	O
From	O
the	O
matters	O
communicated	O
to	O
the	O
directors	O
,	O
we	O
determine	O
those	O
matters	O
that	O
were	O
of	O
most	O
significance	O
in	O
the	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
and	O
are	O
therefore	O
the	O
key	O
audit	O
matters.	O
We	O
describe	O
these	O
matters	O
in	O
our	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
unless	O
law	O
or	O
regulation	O
precludes	O

disclosure	O
about	O
the	O
matter	O
or	O
when	O
,	O

extremely	O

circumstances	O
,	O

determine	O
that	O
a	O
matter	O

not	O

shares	O
carry	O
one	O
vote	O
per	O
ordinary	O
share	O
without	O
restriction.	O

options	O
have	O
no	O
voting	O
rights.	O

the	O
Company	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O

with	O

is	O

Au	O
prospect	O
to	O

up	O

Randall	O
•	O

to	O

and	O

the	O

of	O

within	O
